Active front headrests, designed to limit whiplash injuries by cradling the head more effectively in a rear impact, are also added as standard equipment in 2009. The Avalon Touring, originally created for those who wanted a slightly sportier driving experience, has been canceled due to lack of interest.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Toyota; Vehicle Stability Control; 	DATE: 2009; 2009; 	LOCATION: Avalon; 	NOUN: Toyota; link; Avalon; safety package; Vehicle Stability Control; VSC; standard; models; headrests; whiplash injuries; head; impact; equipment; Avalon Touring; experience; lack; interest; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1763063096 6 41----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	gener:1 manifold:1 variabl:2 substanti:1 flow:1 foundat:1 torqu:1 ga:1 freewai:1 time:1 overhead:1 moreov:1 rpm:1 power:1 avalon:2 move:1 limit:1 onto:1 liter:1 smoothli:1 pedal:1 sign:1 powertrain:1 bit:2 acceler:1 floor:1 peppi:1 merg:1 small:1 pound:1 car:1 might:1 stop:1 smooth:1 paper:1 engin:1 stage:1 dual:2 author:1 thank:1 casual:1 horsepow:1 cam:1 evenli:1 valv:1 crowd:1 surprisingli:1 peaki:1 feet:1 seem:1 idl:1 fact:1 larg:1 rel:1 intak:1	||	The foundation for Avalon's smoothness is its powertrain. On paper, its 3.5-liter V6 engine might seem a bit small for a relatively large car. In fact, the Avalon is surprisingly peppy. The dual overhead-cam V6 generates a substantial 268 horsepower and 248 pound feet of torque, and it moves the Avalon with authority. Moreover, thanks to variable valve timing and a dual-stage variable intake manifold, the power isn't the least bit peaky. It flows smoothly and evenly from idle to the engine's 6200-rpm limit, whether you're accelerating casually from a stop sign or flooring the gas pedal to merge onto a crowded freeway.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Avalon; 	NOUN: foundation; Avalon; smoothness; powertrain; paper; 3.5-liter V6 engine; bit; car; fact; Avalon; overhead-cam V6; horsepower; pound feet; torque; Avalon; authority; thanks; valve timing; intake manifold; power; bit peaky; engine; limit; stop sign; flooring; gas pedal; freeway; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1763063096 6 42----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:2 anyth:1 mph:1 second:1 wheel:1 manifest:1 typic:1 perform:1 carri:1 enough:2 torqu:3 disturb:1 eight:1 slight:1 luggag:1 easili:1 longer:1 noth:1 power:1 driver:2 especi:1 slow:1 hard:1 avalon:2 hood:1 breath:1 usual:1 speed:1 creat:1 let:1 sport:1 piec:1 know:1 peopl:1 bit:1 acceler:2 floor:1 larg:1 steer:3 lot:1 insid:1 room:1 letharg:1 tug:1	||	The V6 has enough torque to create a bit of torque steer when you floor it from a slow speed. Torque steer usually manifests itself as a slight tug on the steering wheel under hard acceleration. In the Avalon, it's nothing that will disturb the typical driver, but it's enough to let that driver know that there's a powerful piece under the hood. The Avalon will easily accelerate from 0 to 60 mph in less than eight seconds, and while that's no longer sports car performance, it's anything but lethargic, especially in a large car that carries five people and their luggage with lots of room to breathe inside.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Avalon; Avalon; 	NOUN: V6; torque; bit; torque; floor; speed; Torque; tug; wheel; acceleration; Avalon; nothing; driver; driver; piece; hood; Avalon; mph; seconds; sports car performance; anything; car; people; luggage; lots; room; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

We tried the transmission's manual shift feature on a swoopy two-lane road, tapping the sequential shift lever between second and third and keeping the engine spinning near its redline. We discovered in the process that Avalon can be something like a sport sedan, because the V6 is happy to run at high rpm.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Avalon; 	NOUN: gear; overdrive; Avalon cruises; fashion; freeway; engine; speed; transmission; shift feature; road; shift lever; engine; redline; process; Avalon; something; sport sedan; V6; rpm; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The ride is silky smooth in nearly all circumstances, and rarely does a road shock ruffle the occupants. The softly tuned suspension means Avalon wants to lean over in faster turns. Yet the body movement is well controlled, and the Avalon doesn't feel floating or disconnected. Its steering falls on the light side, with a lot of power assist, but it responds directly to movement of the wheel. We might call Avalon cushy but good. It holds its line nicely when driven reasonably quickly through a series of curves, whether the road surface is smooth or bumpy.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Avalon; Avalon; 	NOUN: sedan; comfort; suspension settings; ride; smooth; circumstances; road shock; occupants; suspension; Avalon; turns; body movement; Avalon; steering; side; lot; power; movement; wheel; Avalon; line; series; curves; road surface; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Yet its trademark might be the peaceful stillness inside. At a stoplight in the city center, the whirring hubbub outside the Avalon sounds like a muted purr to its driver and passengers. At 75 mph on the expressway, about the only sound you'll hear is a soft crack from the tires as they slap over pavement joints, and 15 percent volume with some soft music will take care of that. The Avalon is exceptionally smooth, too, especially for its price. At freeway speeds, you'll feel less vibration through the steering column, seat bottoms or floorboards than you would in some luxury cars that cost 20,000 more.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Avalon; 	NOUN: Avalon; driver; trademark; stillness; stoplight; city center; hubbub; Avalon; purr; driver; passengers; mph; expressway; sound; crack; tires; slap; pavement joints; percent volume; music; care; Avalon; price; freeway speeds; vibration; column; seat bottoms; floorboards; luxury cars; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1763063096 5 1----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	gener:1 roomi:1 show:1 carri:1 toyota:1 jest:1 help:2 rate:1 area:1 current:1 joke:1 power:1 stuck:1 effici:1 reput:1 worth:1 avalon:2 man:1 look:1 turn:1 hill:1 redesign:1 depend:1 qualiti:1 list:1 regard:1 soon:1 young:1 fogeyish:1 penchant:1 around:1 bodi:1 glitch:1 afraid:1 offic:1 comfort:2 reliabl:1 definit:1 due:1 ballad:1 rel:1 debut:1 ag:1	||	Around the office, I carry the reputation if in jest of being an over-the-hill man stuck in a young guy's body. My penchant for fogeyish jokes and power ballads doesn't help. Even less helpful, I'm afraid, will be my regard for the Toyota Avalon. It's roomy, efficient and comfortable. There were some reliability glitches when the current generation debuted for 2005, but it's since turned out to be relatively dependable. The Avalon is due for a redesign soon, and it is showing its age in some areas. But if comfort and quality rate high on your list, it's definitely worth a look.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Toyota Avalon; 	DATE: 2005; 	NOUN: office; reputation; jest; man; guy; body; penchant; jokes; power ballads; regard; Toyota Avalon; reliability glitches; generation; Avalon; redesign; age; areas; comfort; quality rate; list; look; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1763063096 5 9----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	minor:1 cours:1 substanti:1 particular:1 enough:1 highwai:1 though:1 doctor:1 expect:2 nois:1 twitchi:1 roll:1 requir:1 correct:1 smidg:1 precis:1 lucern:1 avalon:2 follow:1 turn:2 famili:1 consist:1 assist:1 fun:1 size:2 bodi:1 soak:1 low:1 fast:1 try:1 plant:1 car:2 ride:2 littl:1 expert:1 cabin:1 realli:1 wheel:2 sloppi:1 bump:1 disturb:1 recommend:1 softli:1 easi:1 full:2 easili:1 serv:1 isol:1 feel:2 constant:1 corner:1 speed:1 handl:1 remind:1 exhibit:1 suspens:1 maxima:1 stai:1 steer:3 yet:1	||	Like most full-size family cars, the Avalon rides softly. The suspension soaks up bumps with some noise but little cabin disturbance, yet handling isn't as sloppy as I would expect with such an isolated ride. The steering wheel turns easily at low speeds, though it isn't as well-assisted as in the Lucerne and 300. Try to take the Avalon through some fast corners, and the substantial	##false@@false$$	body roll	##false@@true$$	will serve as a constant reminder that you're having more fun than your doctor recommends. But it's easy enough to follow through a turn, as the steering exhibits consistent if not really expert precision. On the highway, the wheel feels a smidge too twitchy, requiring more minor corrections to stay on course than I'd expect in a full-size car. The Maxima in particular has a more planted steering feel.	##false@@false$$		||	LOCATION: Lucerne; 	NOUN: family cars; Avalon rides; suspension; bumps; noise; cabin disturbance; ride; wheel; speeds; Lucerne; Avalon; corners; body roll; reminder; fun; doctor; turn; steering; precision; highway; wheel; smidge; corrections; course; car; Maxima; feel; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The rear seats are quite comfortable as well. Legroom is abundant even by full-size sedan standards, and the rear seats boast a manually reclining back that allows those passengers to stretch out on long trips. A 6-footer can sit in back with more than enough knee- and headroom, and with a nearly flat floor, getting three into the backseat on carpool day is no problem. One minor annoyance is the inability to fold the rear seats (the trade-off for the reclining feature). -1763063096 7 2----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:1 drop:1 xl:4 necessari:1 heat:1 seat:1 power:1 year:1 head:1 avalon:1 leather:1 option:1 limit:1 cool:1 control:2 assist:1 avail:1 upholsteri:1 leav:1 cd:1 wheel:2 line:1 activ:1 toyota:1 dual:1 restraint:1 sunroof:1 trim:3 brake:1 end:1 top:1 addit:1 safeti:1 standard:1 inch:2 traction:1 come:1 front:1 us:1 stabil:1 climat:1 focu:1 base:1 featur:2 ad:1 chang:1 tour:1 zone:1 changer:1	||	For 2009, the Toyota Avalon drops its Touring trim, leaving us with the base XL, XLS, and top-line Limited. Most of the changes this year focus on safety, with the addition of standard traction and stability control, brake assist, and active front head restraints for all trims. XLs come more than well equipped with the now-necessary power features, 16-inch wheels, dual-zone climate control, and a 6-CD changer. High-end features, such as 17-inch wheels, leather upholstery, heated and cooled seats, and a sunroof are available as options for the XL and get added on with other trims.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Toyota Avalon; XLS; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Toyota Avalon; Touring; base XL; XLS; changes; year focus; safety; addition; traction; stability control; brake; head restraints; trims; XLs; power features; wheels; climate control; changer; features; wheels; leather upholstery; seats; sunroof; options; XL; trims; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Its 0-60 times fall around 6.5 seconds. It comes paired with a 6-speed shiftable automatic, and together they deliver 268 hp and 248 lb-ft of torque at 4,700 RPM. For it size, the Avalon packs a wallop, and drivers feel confident in its off-the-line and highway acceleration performance. Equipped with variable valve timing for improved fuel economy, EPA estimates average 19/28 mpg, though some happy owners claim to get anywhere from 35 to 40 mpg on the highway.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Avalon; Avalon; EPA; 	NOUN: hood; Avalon; DOHC V6 engine; plenty; power; highway; ride; times; seconds; hp; lb-ft; torque; RPM; size; Avalon; wallop; drivers; highway acceleration performance; valve timing; fuel economy; EPA; mpg; owners; mpg; highway; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

A reviewer from 2008 compared the interior to a Lexus. Power windows, locks, and mirrors, remote entry, wheel-mounted cruise and audio controls, a power driver's seat, and a 9-speaker 6-CD player with MP3 jack are all standard for the XL. The midrange XLS adds a 4-way power passenger seat, leather upholstery, a garage remote, heated mirrors, a sunroof, and faux wood trim. The Limited targets those who don't like to leave their living room when they drive. It upgrades to heated and cooled front seats, premium leather upholstery, keyless start, a rear sunshade, and a 12-speaker JBL audio system with 7.1 surround sound. The big V-6 has plenty of smooth power for a sedan of this size, but it's less growly than in other Mitsubishis. The 2.4-liter four-cylinder engine hustles the LS around, and its suspension absorbs most road impacts well. Tighten up the line into a curve and you notice more imprecision in the rear end, a little squirm, and some movement before it settles into predictable tire squeal. The Ralliart is tighter and more composed. On all versions, the steering is nicely weighted, brake modulation good, and pedal travel short.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mitsubishi; The Ralliart; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Mitsubishi Galant sedans; engine; LS; suspension; road impacts; line; curve; imprecision; end; squirm; movement; tire squeal; Ralliart; versions; steering; brake modulation; pedal travel; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

In addition to the upgraded sport fabric seats (featuring heated front seats), The black, marble-esque dash inserts were prone to smudging but did not detract from the clean interior. From the driver's seat, three large gauges are easy to read, while the center stack flowed smoothly from the soft, rubbery upper instrument panel covering. The bright silver lower center stack that housed all radio and HVAC controls helped to break up the span of darkness that was the Galant's interior. On lengthy road trips, the seats and center armrest provided exceptional levels of comfort.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: HVAC; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Galant; addition; sport fabric seats; seats; dash inserts; interior; driver; seat; center; instrument panel; silver; center; radio; HVAC controls; span; darkness; Galant; interior; road trips; seats; center armrest; levels; comfort; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

1701897961 0 7----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:1 interior:1 ralliart:3 player:1 exterior:1 midsiz:1 beig:1 heat:2 upgrad:1 level:2 seat:3 aluminum:1 power:2 leather:1 option:1 rockford:1 plu:1 control:3 mitsubishi:1 avail:1 fosgat:1 tune:1 pedal:1 alloi:2 system:3 sedan:1 sound:1 stitch:1 auto:1 air:1 cd:2 wheel:5 accessori:1 engin:1 navig:1 add:1 automat:1 six:2 mirror:2 dim:1 galant:3 style:1 full:1 side:1 sunroof:1 cruis:1 driver:1 accent:1 trim:3 brake:1 condit:1 rearview:1 inch:3 audio:2 tilt:1 speaker:1 larger:1 edit:2 sport:6 come:1 front:1 offer:1 steel:1 satellit:1 climat:1 suspens:1 mount:1 steer:2 similarli:1 featur:1 base:1 radio:1 enhanc:1 es:2 changer:1	||	The 2009 Mitsubishi Galant is a midsize sedan available in four trim levels: ES, Sport Edition, Sport V6 and Ralliart. The base ES comes with 16-inch steel wheels, air-conditioning, a tilt steering wheel, full power accessories, cruise control and a six-speaker sound system with a CD/MP3 player. The Sport Edition adds 17-inch alloy wheels, heated side mirrors, a sunroof, automatic climate control, steering-wheel-mounted audio controls, an auto-dimming rearview mirror, a power driver seat and heated front seats. The Sport V6 is equipped similarly but has a V6 engine and an upgraded Rockford Fosgate audio system with a six-CD changer and satellite radio. The Galant Ralliart trim level has the Sport Edition's features plus 18-inch alloy wheels, a sport-tuned suspension, larger brakes, exterior styling enhancements, leather seating, beige interior accent stitching and aluminum pedals. The Ralliart offers the option of a navigation system, the only Galant trim to do so.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mitsubishi Galant; Sport Edition; Ralliart; Sport Edition; Rockford Fosgate; Galant Ralliart; Ralliart; 	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: ES; 	NOUN: Mitsubishi Galant; sedan; levels; ES; Sport Edition; Sport V6; Ralliart; base ES; steel wheels; air-conditioning; tilt; wheel; power accessories; cruise control; sound system; CD\/MP3 player; Sport Edition; alloy wheels; side; sunroof; climate control; audio controls; rearview mirror; power driver seat; seats; Sport V6; V6 engine; Rockford Fosgate; system; changer; satellite radio; Galant Ralliart; level; Sport Edition; features; alloy wheels; suspension; brakes; exterior styling enhancements; leather seating; accent stitching; aluminum pedals; Ralliart; option; navigation system; Galant; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The C300 is powered by a 228-hp, 3.0-liter V-6, and the pricier C350 comes with a 268-hp, 3.5-liter V-6. A six-speed manual is available on the C300, but most C-classes are equipped with an excellent seven-speed automatic transmission. We drove a good half-dozen of these and all had the same thing. It didn't feel like lag exactly, but more a momentary disconnect between the throttle and the engine which didn't inspire cofidence in traffic cut and thrust, going for a gap you'd probably miss it when the car fails to respond. The later 7 speed didn't show evidence of this. That and the fact the dimpled and exapnsive wasteland of unadorned plastic made the dash look sub-premium stopped us from buying one. The interior facelift was more nip and tuck then reconstructive and the end effect remained underwhelmingly - you would have to order the satnav option just to give you something to look at. With some bargaining we got a late CLK350 Avantagrde with not many more k's then C classes of this generation for the same money - inclusive of all the options you could find on the C class and then some, the 7 speed trans and a lot more power. Mercedes sheet metal is constantly aped by mainstream manufacturers looking to borrow some "prestige", the C class with the Classic or Elegance face looks very generic, like an Accord or Grandeur. The larger proportions of the E class work much better with the plainer face.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: hesitancy; standstill; C200; speed box; half-dozen; thing; lag; throttle; engine; cofidence; traffic cut; thrust; gap; car; speed; evidence; fact; wasteland; plastic; dash look sub-premium; facelift; nip; end effect; satnav option; something; bargaining; CLK350 Avantagrde; k; C classes; generation; money; inclusive; options; C class; speed trans; lot; power; Mercedes sheet metal; manufacturers; prestige; C class; Elegance face; Accord; Grandeur; proportions; E class work; face; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-250512197 4 11----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	store:1 exterior:1 torqu:1 seat:1 drive:4 file:1 year:1 luxuri:1 option:2 avail:1 curtain:1 digit:1 ethanol:1 system:1 split:1 wheelbas:1 headlamp:1 audi:1 wheel:3 slightli:1 launch:1 engin:1 run:1 transmiss:3 six:1 version:1 mixtur:1 side:2 length:1 left:1 hard:1 complet:1 held:1 redesign:1 us:1 front:1 competitor:1 divis:1 interior:1 percent:2 overal:1 perform:1 gasolin:1 uniqu:2 compact:1 antiskid:1 altern:1 longer:1 power:1 bi:1 hood:1 control:2 except:1 liter:3 class:2 tune:1 xenon:1 ct:1 sedan:3 bmw:1 got:1 compar:1 antilock:1 pound:1 hp:1 model:4 seri:1 amg:2 dome:1 navig:1 automat:3 airbag:2 style:1 horsepow:2 develop:1 brake:1 music:1 safeti:1 includ:4 standard:3 speed:2 cadillac:1 premium:1 merced:3 rear:3 edit:1 traction:1 sport:5 feet:1 came:1 offer:2 fold:1 suspens:1 manual:1 seven:1 featur:2 benz:1	||	Mercedes-Benz's premium compact C-Class sedan got a complete redesign for 2008, which left it slightly longer in wheelbase and overall length compared to the 2001-2007 version. Three models were offered. The C300 Luxury and C300 Sport editions held a 228-horsepower 3.0-liter V6. The C350 Sport used a 268-hp 3.5-liter V6. All came with a seven-speed automatic transmission except the C300 Sport, which had a standard six-speed manual transmission and offered the automatic as an option. Automatic-transmission rear-wheel-drive C300s could run on E85, a mixture of 85 percent ethanol and 15 percent gasoline. C300 models were available with Mercedes' 4Matic all-wheel drive as an alternative to the standard rear-wheel drive. Sport models had a sport suspension and unique interior and exterior styling. Standard safety features included antilock brakes, traction control, antiskid control, front side airbags, and curtain side airbags. Options included a navigation system (including a hard drive for storing digital music files), bi-xenon headlamps, and a 60/40 split-folding rear seat. C-Class competitors included the Audi A4, BMW 3-Series, and Cadillac CTS. During the 2008 model year, Mercedes-Benz launched a C63 AMG sedan tuned by the company's performance division. The C63's 6.2-liter V8 engine developed 451 horsepower and 443 pound-feet of torque. C63 AMG sedans feature a unique power-dome hood.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mercedes-Benz; Audi; BMW; Cadillac CTS; Mercedes-Benz; AMG; AMG; 	DATE: 2008; 2008; 	NOUN: Mercedes-Benz; premium; C-Class sedan; redesign; wheelbase; length; version; models; C300 Luxury; C300 Sport editions; 3.0-liter V6; C350 Sport; 3.5-liter V6; transmission; C300 Sport; six-speed manual transmission; option; Automatic-transmission; C300s; E85; mixture; percent ethanol; percent gasoline; C300 models; Mercedes; drive; alternative; rear-wheel drive; Sport models; sport suspension; interior; exterior styling; Standard safety features; brakes; traction control; control; side airbags; curtain side airbags; Options; navigation system; drive; music files; headlamps; seat; C-Class competitors; Audi A4; BMW 3-Series; Cadillac CTS; model year; Mercedes-Benz; C63 AMG sedan; company; performance division; C63; V8 engine; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; C63 AMG sedans; power-dome hood; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The C300 models are available with 4Matic all-wheel drive, a full-time system that reverts to sending 55 percent of power to the rear wheels when more isn't needed at a particular wheel. The C300 has a standard six-speed manual or optional seven-speed automatic, but the C350 can only be had with the automatic.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Sport; 	NOUN: C300 Luxury; Sport models; V-6 engine; C350 Sport; V-6; C300 models; drive; system; percent; power; wheels; wheel; C300; six-speed manual; C350; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-250512197 3 7----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 equip:1 mountain:1 decreas:1 normal:1 maintain:1 perform:1 agil:1 notic:1 help:1 maneuv:1 drive:2 motion:1 demand:1 control:2 respons:1 smoothli:1 flat:1 signific:1 qualiti:1 class:4 without:2 bodi:1 acceler:1 throttl:1 ratio:1 sedan:1 better:1 sacrific:1 compar:1 ride:3 model:2 allow:1 decis:1 set:1 sudden:1 engin:1 former:1 road:1 quit:1 automat:1 mode:1 thank:1 damper:1 full:1 adjust:1 direct:1 feel:1 addit:1 corner:1 quicker:1 crisp:1 speed:1 merced:2 sport:1 come:1 us:1 quickli:1 handl:1 manual:1 suspens:1 differ:1 stai:1 seven:1 downshift:1 comfort:1 mechan:1 steer:3 benz:1 spirit:1 reduc:1 part:1 shift:1	||	The two V-6 engines aren't that different from each other in normal driving, but the additional performance of the 2009 Mercedes-Benz C350 is only noticeable during full-throttle acceleration or on the most demanding mountain roads. The seven-speed automatic shifts smoothly, whether using the manual mode or not, and it downshifts quickly and decisively when needed. The C-Class comes equipped with Mercedes' Agility Control suspension, which helps C-Class models stay flat in corners and maintain a well-controlled ride by mechanically adjusting damper settings to reduce body motion during spirited driving and sudden maneuvers, without a sacrifice in ride comfort. The C-Class has crisp steering response compared to former C-Class sedans, thanks in part to a quicker steering ratio, but the steering isn't quite as direct in feel. Of the two models, the Sport allows better handling without any significant decrease in ride quality.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mercedes-Benz; Mercedes ' Agility Control; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: V-6 engines; driving; performance; Mercedes-Benz C350; acceleration; mountain roads; shifts; manual mode; C-Class; Mercedes; Agility Control suspension; C-Class models; corners; ride; damper settings; body motion; driving; maneuvers; sacrifice; ride comfort; C-Class; response; C-Class sedans; thanks; part; steering ratio; steering; feel; models; Sport; handling; decrease; ride quality; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

1874393055 1 11----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	scion:1 vehicl:1 gener:1 slate:1 door:3 lone:1 prior:1 cylind:1 level:2 fail:1 basic:1 drive:1 hyundai:1 year:2 korea:1 option:1 xd:1 sold:1 liter:1 canada:2 avail:1 team:1 aveo:2 powertrain:1 bodi:1 system:1 honda:1 market:2 sedan:1 chevrolet:1 subcompact:1 materi:1 canadian:1 wave:2 air:1 gs:1 antilock:1 cd:1 call:1 model:4 compet:1 engin:1 automat:1 transmiss:1 introduc:1 airbag:1 fit:1 share:1 style:1 side:1 motor:1 horsepow:1 accent:1 initi:1 slot:1 trim:1 built:1 brake:1 hatchback:2 condit:1 includ:1 audio:1 standard:2 speed:2 later:1 entri:1 us:3 front:2 offer:1 manual:1 plan:1 featur:1 south:1 design:1 pontiac:2 divis:1	||	Introduced for 2009, the Pontiac G3 was a new entry-level vehicle for the U.S. market from this General Motors division. This subcompact, front-drive, four-door hatchback slotted below Pontiac's GS, sharing its basic design and powertrain with the Chevrolet Aveo. Like Aveo, the G3 was built in South Korea. The lone G3 engine was as 106-horsepower 1.6-liter four-cylinder that teamed with a five-speed manual or four-speed automatic transmission. Front side airbags were standard. Antilock braking was an option. Only one trim level was offered. Standard features included air conditioning and a CD/MP3 audio system. Prior to model-year 2009, the G3 was marketed in Canada as the Pontiac Wave (2009 Canadian models were called G3 Wave). Initially, all G3 models slated for the U.S. were four-door hatchbacks. A four-door sedan was sold in Canada, and planned for availability in the U.S. later in the model year. That body style failed to materialize. Pontiac's G3 competed against the Honda Fit, Hyundai Accent, and Scion xD.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: General Motors; Chevrolet Aveo; Honda Fit; Hyundai Accent; 	DATE: 2009; 2009; 2009; 	LOCATION: Pontiac; U.S.; Pontiac; South Korea; Canada; Pontiac; U.S.; Canada; U.S.; Pontiac; 	NOUN: Pontiac G3; vehicle; U.S. market; General Motors division; subcompact; hatchback; Pontiac; GS; design; powertrain; Chevrolet Aveo; Aveo; G3; South Korea; G3 engine; manual; transmission; Front side airbags; option; level; Standard features; air conditioning; CD\/MP3 audio system; G3; Canada; Pontiac Wave; models; G3 Wave; G3 models; U.S.; hatchbacks; sedan; Canada; availability; U.S.; model year; body style; Pontiac; G3; Honda Fit; Hyundai Accent; Scion xD; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

1874393055 3 4----Price----#text.BLOCKQUOTE.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.LI.OL.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	plastic:4 simpl:1 textur:1 higher:1 nice:1 door:1 good:1 enough:1 switchblad:1 notic:1 thicker:1 eight:1 kei:3 center:1 almost:1 gui:1 seat:2 automobil:1 head:1 cool:1 except:1 unlock:2 support:1 everyth:1 get:1 plate:1 class:1 mark:1 piec:1 much:1 price:1 touch:1 softer:1 start:1 sedan:1 remot:1 column:1 stereo:1 own:1 brass:1 match:1 stack:1 big:1 vari:1 room:2 car:3 grab:1 weight:1 lumbar:1 mirror:1 reach:2 keyless:1 easili:1 adjust:2 mean:1 ford:1 note:1 scratch:1 law:1 includ:1 let:1 entri:1 clearli:1 front:1 us:2 seem:2 around:1 remind:1 settl:1 focu:2 felt:1 comfort:1 steer:1 nickel:1 insid:1 within:1 brother:1 plenti:1	||	As I grabbed the key I was reminded that this is a simple automobile. No keyless entry, no remote start, no cool switchblade key, just a piece of nickel-plated brass with a plastic head. After unlocking the car with the key, getting in and reaching over to unlock the passenger's door to let my brother-in-law in, we noticed that the car had plenty of room up front for both of us, and we're both big guys. He owns a 2006 Ford Focus sedan and we felt the G3 matched the Focus in comfort and had almost as much room. We settled in and adjusted the seats, mirrors, steering column and stereo, noting that everything was within reach and clearly marked. The driver's seat is eight-way adjustable if you include the lumbar support. The plastics used inside vary in texture and all seemed good enough for this class of car except some of the plastic around the center stack that seemed to scratch very easily. It would be nice to have thicker, softer-touch plastics, but that would mean more weight and a higher price.	##false@@false$$		||	DATE: 2006; 	NOUN: key; automobile; entry; start; switchblade key; piece; brass; head; car; key; passenger; door; brother-in-law; car; plenty; room; front; guys; Ford Focus sedan; G3; Focus; comfort; room; seats; column; stereo; everything; reach; driver; seat; support; plastics; texture; class; car; plastic; center; plastics; weight; price; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
1874393055 3 5----DriveRide----#text.BLOCKQUOTE.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.LI.OL.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	ecotec:1 plastic:1 last:1 save:1 pull:2 street:2 higher:1 nice:5 bounci:1 underpow:1 enough:1 highwai:1 notic:1 torqu:1 though:1 nois:2 rubberi:1 feedback:1 contribut:1 freewai:2 damp:1 gear:2 drive:1 buzz:1 accur:2 busi:1 power:1 decemb:1 light:1 vibe:1 onto:2 prove:1 suburban:1 dai:1 lack:1 steadi:1 bit:1 bottom:1 fewer:1 economi:1 wore:1 lb:1 bar:1 merg:1 try:1 poorli:1 car:2 littl:2 weight:3 give:1 ship:1 set:1 coupl:1 protect:1 run:1 affect:1 sprung:1 throw:1 easi:1 suburb:1 clutch:1 fuel:1 fine:1 brake:1 feel:2 beat:1 corner:1 speed:1 swai:1 regular:1 rear:1 us:1 handl:1 around:2 abnorm:1 suspens:1 felt:5 longish:1 comfort:1 steer:2 shift:1 found:1	||	As I set off, I noticed that the gear shift was accurate, but felt a bit rubbery and had longish throws. The clutch was nicely weighted for an economy car though, and I found it easy to get used to. Driving around the suburban streets I felt the steering was nicely weighted and accurate, but lacked feel. The brakes were affective and nicely weighted, but like the steering, didn't give you any feedback. The 106HP 1.6L ECOTEC and it's 105FT-LB of torque proved to be enough power to pull the little G3 around the suburbs as well as pulling out onto a busy highway and merging onto the freeway. It never felt underpowered or poorly geared. Once on the freeway and running at 65MPH it felt steady and comfortable. The suspension felt nicely sprung and damped, never feeling bouncy or bottoming out. On regular streets it handles fine, but more sway bar would be nice for higher-speed cornering when you're trying to beat the lights and save fuel. The only abnormal noise was a little buzz from the rear, but this car still wore all of it's plastic shipping protection and could have contributed to it. Still, it made fewer noises than the 2009 Vibe I had for a couple of days last December.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: L ECOTEC; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: gear shift; bit; clutch; economy car; streets; steering; feel; brakes; steering; feedback; 106HP; L ECOTEC; 105FT-LB; torque; power; G3; suburbs; highway; freeway; freeway; suspension; bouncy; streets; bar; cornering; lights; fuel; noise; buzz; rear; car; shipping protection; noises; Vibe; couple; days; December; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The armrests were useless, however, as we were too tall. The manual window cranks are out of the way of your legs, but easy to reach and use. The manual door lock knobs are located on the top edge of the door panels and are easy to reach. I was able to comfortably enter and sit in the rear seat with the front seat in my normal driving position. The adjustable rear headrests also did their job for me in their highest position. The rear seat folds and tumbles to create more cargo room when you need it, but with the rear seats in place you should be able to get your daily cargo in and out easily. 1874393055 0 2----Price----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:1 particularli:1 mpg:3 segment:1 overal:1 notabl:1 door:1 good:1 increasingli:1 enough:1 ga:1 wallet:1 though:1 almost:1 cover:1 prerequisit:1 fail:1 basic:1 drive:2 combin:1 hyundai:1 pleasant:1 diminut:1 mileag:1 sibl:1 easier:1 remov:1 far:1 dai:1 bad:1 provid:1 cost:1 much:1 frankli:1 system:1 price:2 honda:1 start:1 subcompact:1 better:1 popular:1 impress:1 sticker:1 onstar:1 economi:2 distinguish:1 hatch:1 low:2 foothold:1 car:1 yari:2 cabin:1 superior:1 give:1 automat:1 toyota:1 fit:2 rate:1 area:1 vastli:1 chintzier:1 fuel:2 accent:1 exclus:1 cheaper:1 conveni:1 technic:1 standard:1 come:1 pallid:1 item:1 expens:1 base:2 nissan:1 excit:1 pontiac:1 divis:1 yet:1	||	Though far removed from Pontiac's "We Are Driving Excitement" days of old, the G3 does give the division a foothold in the increasingly popular subcompact segment. A low price and good fuel economy are prerequisites here, and the G3 technically has these bases covered with a sticker that starts under 15,000 and overall fuel economy rated as high as 30 mpg. However, the G3's 14,335 base price frankly isn't low enough for what you get. Like its cheaper Aveo5 sibling, the G3 fails to distinguish itself in any area, yet this pallid Pontiac costs almost as much as the vastly superior Honda Fit. The G3 is equipped with some basic convenience items and comes standard with GM's exclusive OnStar system, but its cabin is notably chintzier than the less-expensive Nissan Versa's. Three-door hatches like the Hyundai Accent and Toyota Yaris and are at once easier on the wallet and more pleasant to drive. The G3's combined 30 mpg (28 mpg with the automatic) isn't bad, but nor is it particularly impressive for such a diminutive car -- both the Yaris and Fit provide better gas mileage.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Honda; GM; Nissan Versa 's; Hyundai Accent; Toyota Yaris; 	LOCATION: Pontiac; Pontiac; 	NOUN: Pontiac; Excitement; days; G3; division; foothold; subcompact segment; price; fuel economy; prerequisites; G3; bases; sticker; fuel economy; mpg; G3; base price; Aveo5 sibling; G3; area; Pontiac costs; Honda Fit; G3; convenience items; standard; GM; OnStar system; cabin; Nissan Versa; hatches; Hyundai Accent; Toyota Yaris; wallet; G3; mpg; mpg; car; Yaris; Fit; gas mileage; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Any wheel spin whatsoever results in the sudden and harsh implementation of traction control (TRAC) amid loud dings and flashing lights on the dashboard, making it about as entertaining to drive as if my grandmother perpetually resided in the passenger seat. If you happen to be looking for a luxurious, yet sport-minded sedan that will stir your soul and rouse the senses, it would be best to look toward the IS250 or 350. If your hobbies tend to favor the opera house instead of the oval course, than chances are you will find the ES350 matches your civilized tastes. The six-speed automatic transmission boasts a Super Electronically Controlled Transmission (Super ECT) with overdrive and a sequential multi-mode shifter meaning that gear changes are swift and the engine always has enough power to pass on the highway or merge with traffic. There may not be one; the new RL sports a class-leading array of electronics that help it provide quick, supple transportation to four or five passengers. With a base price of about 47,000, the 2009 RL sits in a hotly contested segment of BMWs, Benzes, and Lexuses but is far more at home in a smaller subset of all-wheel-drive, near-luxury sedans that includes the Audi A6 and Volvo S80. The huge, shield-shaped grille clashes with the subtle, innocuous roofline. The nose vaguely recalls a bottle opener. The rear end sits plainly, with a wide band of metallic trim and LED tail lamps to liven it up. None of the aggression of the front end works its way inside the Acura RL; the cabin s handsome waterfall of wood trim is punctuated by metallic-trimmed controls, muted tones of brown or gray, and lots of high-quality leather and plastic. It s a quiet, relaxed feel despite the array of buttons and knobs that run the show. 2116344913 4 4----Price----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mpg:1 curb:1 perform:2 blunt:1 mediocr:1 outright:1 highwai:1 acura:1 ponder:1 torqu:1 though:2 expect:1 brisk:1 drive:1 rang:1 respond:2 precis:1 rpm:1 power:1 luxuri:3 right:1 breath:1 control:2 liter:1 integra:1 compani:1 class:1 qualiti:1 nsx:1 deliveri:1 bit:1 input:2 price:1 throttl:1 near:1 sedan:2 standstil:1 impress:1 economi:1 comput:2 citi:1 big:1 pound:2 ride:1 might:1 accomplish:1 rev:1 smooth:1 weight:1 wheel:1 peak:1 rl:3 give:1 paper:1 automat:1 push:1 par:1 supercar:1 paddl:1 name:1 fuel:1 horsepow:1 built:1 hard:1 hatchback:1 top:1 direct:1 feel:2 flick:1 fingertip:1 technic:1 standard:1 speed:1 inject:1 feet:1 factor:1 quickli:1 zest:1 mechan:1 competitor:1 somewhat:1 step:1 shift:1	||	On paper, the 2009 Acura RL performs right on par with many luxury-sedan competitors. A big, 3.7-liter V-6 with direct injection pushes out 300 horsepower and 271 pound-feet of torque, but power delivery peaks near the top of its rev range at and above 5,000 rpm. It gives the RL a somewhat hard-breathing feel, though step-off from a standstill feels brisk, and its five-speed, paddle-shifted automatic responds quickly to flicks of the fingertips. The impression of outright performance is blunted by a few factors: namely, a 4,000-pound curb weight, standard all-wheel drive controlled by computers, and throttle input also controlled by computers. The RL responds to inputs with less mechanical precision than you might expect from the company that built the NSX supercar and the Integra hatchback. It s a bit ponderous, not at all zestful, though technically accomplished. Ride quality is smooth and luxury-like, and fuel economy is like other luxury sedans in the same price class: a mediocre 16 mpg city, 22 highway.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acura RL; RL; NSX; Integra; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: paper; Acura RL; par; competitors; V-6; injection; horsepower; pound-feet; torque; power delivery; top; rev range; rpm; RL; feel; step-off; flicks; fingertips; impression; performance; factors; curb weight; drive; computers; throttle input; computers; RL; inputs; precision; company; NSX supercar; Integra hatchback; bit; Ride quality; fuel economy; luxury sedans; price class; mpg city; highway; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
2116344913 4 5----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 ten:1 particularli:1 interior:1 percent:1 wood:1 vehicl:1 cancel:1 challeng:1 acura:1 thicker:1 though:1 nois:3 sho:1 level:1 seat:3 eras:1 longer:1 power:1 margin:1 leather:1 deep:1 knee:1 control:1 support:1 backseat:1 isn:1 qualiti:1 wide:1 figur:1 ampli:1 bit:1 system:1 bodi:1 trunk:2 frame:1 impress:2 sensat:1 filter:1 wheelbas:1 room:1 littl:1 can:1 rl:3 give:1 activ:1 space:2 hand:1 seater:1 side:1 glass:1 sunroof:1 easili:1 best:1 volvo:1 ford:1 fine:1 tall:1 invit:1 inch:3 rich:1 later:1 larger:1 headroom:1 rear:1 front:1 win:1 adult:1 seem:1 soft:1 glossi:1 sit:1 wider:1 comfort:1 larg:1 tauru:1 fall:1 insid:2 construct:1 skimpi:1	||	It s amply comfortable inside, but the 2009 Acura RL is a four-seater at best. Sitting on a 110.2-inch wheelbase, just under 196 inches long and 72.7 inches wide, it s a large vehicle. Interior space, particularly in the backseat, seems less impressive because of the RL s tall body sides. The ten-way power front seats themselves are Volvo-like: soft, giving, and supportive when they need to be. The headroom isn t erased by a deep sunroof frame, and all the controls fall easily to hand though figuring out some of them can be a challenge (more on that later). The rear seats are a little less impressive in the sensations of space, but knee room is still fine even when adults take up all four seats. The trunk is a bit skimpy the 2010 Ford Taurus SHO is marginally longer and wider, and its trunk is 65 percent larger. Where the 2009 RL wins is in the construction quality and noise levels inside; the woods are glossy and rich, the leather inviting, and the noises filtered out with thicker glass and an active noise-cancellation system.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acura RL; Interior; RL; Ford Taurus SHO; RL; 	DATE: 2009; 2010; 2009; 	NOUN: Acura RL; four-seater; wheelbase; inches; inches; vehicle; space; backseat; RL; body sides; power front seats; headroom isn t; sunroof frame; controls; hand; challenge; seats; sensations; space; knee room; adults; seats; trunk; bit; Ford Taurus SHO; trunk; percent; RL wins; construction quality; noise levels; woods; leather; noises; glass; noise-cancellation system; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

There s almost no end to the list of standard and optional equipment ladled into the RL. Each comes with a 10-speaker Bose sound system with a six-DVD-Audio changer, AM/FM/XM tuner, MP3 jack, and USB connectivity. Bluetooth is standard, as is a sunroof, a Smart Entry keyless system, xenon headlights, and active headlights. An industry-leading navigation system is also standard; it integrates with available real-time traffic data from XM for exceptional route and guidance information, though entry via the large knob in the center of the RL s dash can be a chore. 2116344913 11 2----Exterior----#text.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 tl:1 rl:4 quick:1 talent:1 perform:1 acura:2 went:1 modern:1 obviou:1 toward:1 sell:1 behold:1 buyer:1 longer:1 beauti:1 mind:1 happen:1 luxuri:1 sure:1 look:3 awd:1 sibl:1 creat:1 extra:1 ey:1 rear:1 appar:1 pai:1 front:1 problem:1 team:1 sh:1 attract:1 fascia:1 sale:2 strong:1 disagre:1 better:2 mental:1 expens:1 claim:1 case:1 design:1 restyl:1	||	Apparently, beauty is in the eye of the beholder. But in this case I disagree. If you take a look at the old RL and the new RL, it s obvious that a quick restyling of the front and rear fascia was all Acura had in mind to make it look like its siblings. That mentality created two problems. First, the RL is no longer one of the most attractive modern luxury cars on sale. Second, it looks just like the better-selling (and better performing) TL SH-AWD that also happens to be less expensive. Sales of the RL were never very strong, sure, but at least buyers could claim the extra went toward paying Acura s talented design team.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: RL; RL; Acura; 	NOUN: beauty; eye; beholder; case; look; RL; RL; restyling; front; fascia; Acura; mind; siblings; mentality; problems; RL; luxury cars; sale; better-selling; TL SH-AWD; Sales; RL; buyers; Acura; design team; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Say, for instance, you park beside a building and leave the RL stationary for several hours. The sun will pass overhead, East to West, gradually sending that building s shadow onto different parts of the interior. The materials heat up inside the car at different rates; the right side of the vehicle may have leather cool to the touch but the passenger seat may feel like a barbecued cowboy boot. Acura s sensor uses GPS to detect where the sun will be at any given moment, and use the climate control to keep each side of the car at the same temperature.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acura; 	NOUN: sensor; instance; building; RL; hours; sun; East; West; building s; parts; interior; materials heat; car; rates; side; vehicle; leather cool; touch; passenger seat; cowboy boot; Acura; sensor; GPS; sun; moment; climate control; side; car; temperature; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

As before, that gets to all four wheels through a five-speed automatic transmission and Acura's high-tech "SH-AWD" all-wheel drive system, all the better to eliminate torque steer and improve control, stability, and handling. When you leave, the car will say "Goodbye". Smart Entry means never needing to insert a key into the dash to start the car, or remove the fob from your pocket to lock or unlock. Standard fare in the mid-luxury class these days, but in the top-level RL Acura adds pretty much all possible cabin electronics, with a well-integrated, simple to use interface. With Bluetooth connectivity, think of the Technology Package RL as a smartphone with four wheels. It has voice-activated navigation, real-time weather and traffic information, a 10-speaker surround-sound audio system with AM/FM/XM radio, 6 CD or DVD-Audio, an auxiliary jack and USB port (for iPods), calendar, and note-taking ability. It's also a top-notch mid-luxury sedan, with very comfortable perforated leather power front seats ( heated and cooled with the Technology Package) and a more spacious rear seat. Bright backlit LED instruments aid the driver, as does a tilt and telescope power-adjustable steering wheel. Light and GPS sensors in the climate control system sense the sun's position and adjust temperature and ventilation to compensate for asymmetrical solar heat. The new Active Sound Control system improves on the old Active Noise Cancellation (ANC) system and now reduces high as well as low-frequency drivetrain and road noise. (Arthur C. Clarke is down at the White Hart smiling about this...) There are convenient storage spaces around the cabin, and a ski passthrough to the large trunk.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: RL Acura; Technology Package RL; Active Sound Control; ANC; 	PERSON: Arthur C. 2116344913 9 7----Safety----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	tm:1 unibodi:1 vehicl:2 grill:1 radar:1 disc:1 close:1 sensor:1 seat:1 year:1 head:1 collis:1 control:2 monitor:1 cell:1 assist:1 avail:1 curtain:1 cmb:1 system:2 strong:1 advanc:1 comput:1 antilock:1 compat:1 warn:1 wheel:1 structur:2 engin:1 activ:1 protect:1 airbag:1 dual:1 sophist:1 passeng:2 side:2 restraint:1 deform:1 driver:1 initi:1 brake:3 mitig:1 safeti:2 standard:1 speed:1 rear:1 front:6 us:1 stabil:1 design:1	||	SAFETY:	##true@@false$$	The RL's "Advanced Compatibility Engineering(tm)" unibody structure is designed to protect passengers with controlled-deformation front and rear structures and a strong passenger safety cell. Front-seat active head restraints are new this year. Dual front, front side, and side-curtain airbags are standard, as are four-wheel antilock disc brakes and the Vehicle Stability Assist system. The Collision Mitigation Braking System (CMBS), which uses a radar sensor in the front grille and sophisticated computer control to monitor closing speeds to vehicles in front and warn the driver or even initiate braking, is available.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: RL; Collision Mitigation Braking System; 	NOUN: SAFETY; RL; Advanced Compatibility Engineering; tm; structure; passengers; controlled-deformation front; structures; passenger safety cell; Front-seat; head restraints; year; front; side; airbags; disc brakes; Vehicle Stability Assist system; Collision Mitigation Braking System; CMBS; radar sensor; grille; computer control; closing speeds; vehicles; front; driver; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
2116344913 9 8----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	tm:1 decreas:1 distribut:1 electr:1 torqu:3 upgrad:1 independ:1 tendenc:1 aluminum:1 sportier:1 drive:1 power:1 bush:1 year:1 arm:1 unsprung:1 doubl:1 turn:1 control:1 respons:2 wishbon:1 rotat:1 multilink:1 quiet:1 resist:1 knuckl:1 subfram:1 anc:1 elimin:1 system:2 outsid:1 stiffer:1 split:1 bar:1 util:1 car:2 ride:1 result:1 weight:1 underst:1 wheel:3 optimum:1 give:1 spring:1 push:1 sprung:1 super:1 thank:1 damper:1 faster:1 side:2 corner:1 larger:1 rear:4 traction:1 fulli:1 front:3 tech:1 stabil:1 handl:2 suspens:1 comfort:2 steer:3 improv:1 reduc:2 enhanc:1	||	RIDE AND HANDLING:	##true@@false$$	The RL's fully-independent double-wishbone front, multilink rear suspension utilizes aluminum control arms, steering knuckles, and subframes to reduce both sprung and unsprung weight. For 2009 the electric power steering system has been upgraded, and stiffer springs, dampers, and bushings and a larger rear stabilizer bar give sportier response with no decrease in comfort. The "Super Handling All-Wheel Drive(tm)" system not only splits torque front-to-rear for optimum traction and torque steer elimination, it also distributes torque side-to-side for improved cornering. It's been enhanced this year to reduce understeer ("push", the tendency of a car to resist turning) by rotating the outside rear wheel faster than the front wheels. The result is a comfortable, responsive, and (thanks to ANC) quiet high-tech car.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: RL; ANC; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: RL; front; suspension; aluminum control arms; knuckles; subframes; weight; power steering system; springs; dampers; bushings; stabilizer bar; response; decrease; comfort; Super Handling All-Wheel Drive; tm; system; torque front-to-rear; traction; torque; elimination; torque side-to-side; cornering; year; understeer; push; tendency; car; wheel; wheels; result; thanks; ANC; car; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
2116344913 9 9----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	lower:1 via:1 last:1 singl:1 variabl:1 normal:1 perfectli:1 shine:1 perform:1 torqu:4 time:2 overhead:1 gear:2 sohc:1 drive:1 rang:1 rpm:2 longer:1 copiou:1 import:1 ft:1 sequenti:1 control:3 liter:1 respons:1 smoothli:1 hold:1 number:2 logic:1 much:1 honda:1 sportshift:1 column:1 lift:1 economi:1 everydai:1 lb:1 match:1 low:2 car:1 increas:1 hp:2 weight:1 allow:1 peak:2 engin:2 vs:2 lighter:1 closer:1 automat:1 transmiss:2 mode:2 mai:1 paddl:1 fuel:1 grade:1 horsepow:1 driver:1 tell:1 cam:1 valv:2 fine:1 end:1 complet:1 usual:1 vtec:1 quicker:1 speed:1 sport:2 us:2 quickli:1 seem:1 manual:2 see:1 experi:1 inopportun:1 satisfi:1 steer:1 expens:1 exhaust:1 mid:1 intak:1 shift:4 keep:2	||	PERFORMANCE:	##true@@false$$	Numbers don't tell all. While the new RL's 3.7-liter V6 has more horsepower and torque than last year's 3.5 -- 300 hp at 6300 rpm vs 290 hp at 6200 and 271 lb-ft at 5000 rpm vs 256 at 5000 -- the increase may not seem to be all that much. More important than peak numbers is low- and mid-range torque, and it is there where the new engine shines. It's lighter in weight than the old 3.5, and sees the first use of Honda/Acura's VTEC variable valve timing and lift control on exhaust as well as the intake valves in a single overhead cam (SOHC) engine. It's matched to a five-speed automatic transmission with normal and sport modes, and Sequential SportShift manual shifting via paddles on the steering column. With the copious low-end torque, D is perfectly fine in everyday use, as the transmission shifts quickly and smoothly and Grade Logic Control keeps it from shifting at inopportune times. Sport mode holds gears longer, usually keeps the car in a gear lower than D and so closer to the torque peak for quicker response at the expense of fuel economy. Manual shifting allows the driver complete control, for a more satisfying driving experience.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: RL; Grade Logic Control; 	NOUN: PERFORMANCE; Numbers; RL; 3.7-liter V6; horsepower; torque; year; hp; rpm; hp; lb-ft; rpm; increase; numbers; torque; engine; weight; use; Honda\/Acura; VTEC; valve timing; lift control; exhaust; intake valves; overhead cam; SOHC; engine; transmission; sport modes; SportShift manual; paddles; column; torque; D; use; transmission; Grade Logic Control; times; Sport mode; gears; car; gear; D; torque peak; response; expense; fuel economy; driver; control; experience; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Acura's flagship sedan had standard all-wheel drive. The sole powertrain teamed a 300-horsepower 3.7-liter V6 engine with a five-speed automatic transmission. This combination replaced a 290-hp 3.5-liter V6. Higher-rate coil springs were installed, along with a larger-diameter rear stabilizer bar. Standard safety features included antilock brakes, traction control, antiskid system, front side airbags, and curtain side airbags. Bose Surround Sound audio and solar-sensing climate control were standard. Option groups, actually priced as separate models, included a Technology Package that had a rearview camera and ventilated front seats, plus a voice-activated navigation system with access to real-time traffic and weather information. New features included traffic rerouting and a note function for XM satellite ratio. A second Technology Package added adaptive cruise control and Acura's Collision Mitigation Braking System, which signals of approaching objects and applies the brakes and tightens the front seatbelts if it determines a collision is unavoidable. Also available were a wireless cell-phone link and heated/cooled front seats. With the RL, Acura competed against such models as the Infiniti M, new Jaguar XF, and Mercedes-Benz E-Class.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Acura; XM; Technology Package; Acura; Collision Mitigation Braking System; RL; Acura; Jaguar XF; Mercedes-Benz; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: Acura; premium; sedan; styling; power; automaker; styling; Acura; flagship sedan; drive; powertrain; 3.7-liter V6 engine; transmission; combination; 3.5-liter V6; coil springs; stabilizer bar; Standard safety features; brakes; traction control; system; side airbags; curtain side airbags; Sound audio; climate control; Option groups; models; Technology Package; rearview camera; seats; navigation system; access; traffic; weather information; New features; traffic; note function; XM satellite ratio; Technology Package; cruise control; Acura; Collision Mitigation Braking System; signals; objects; brakes; seatbelts; collision; cell-phone link; seats; RL; Acura; models; Infiniti M; Jaguar XF; Mercedes-Benz E-Class; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

365489985 6 1----Reliability----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 littl:1 japanes:1 terribl:1 convers:1 unreli:1 fool:1 dismal:1 open:1 hear:1 hyundai:1 year:1 arm:1 turn:1 horrif:1 compani:1 exactli:1 excel:1 yugo:1 peugeot:1 korean:1 welcom:1 xenophobia:1 sneer:1 target:1 brand:1 ago:1 try:1	||	Dismal little car. That's what you'd hear 20 years ago when the conversation turned to Hyundai. The Excel wasn't as terrible as a Yugo, or even as horrifically unreliable as sneering Peugeots, but it wasn't exactly welcomed with open arms. Back then, even Japanese brands were still targets of xenophobia; who was this Korean company trying to fool?	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hyundai; 	NOUN: car; years; conversation; Hyundai; Excel; Yugo; Peugeots; arms; brands; targets; xenophobia; company; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Hyundai's Accent could be considered a spiritual successor to the unloved Excel, and it carries on that car's basic formula of delivering a comparable car for less money than the competition. What do you give up to get a car that's not stripped, yet still cheaper?	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hyundai; Hyundai; 	LOCATION: South Korean; 	NOUN: Hyundai; giant; vehicles; recommendations; warranties; business; Hyundai; Accent; successor; Excel; car; formula; car; money; competition; car; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

365489985 6 7----Verdict----#text.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:2 exterior:1 break:1 time:2 rocker:1 oper:1 tear:1 hyundai:1 xb:1 right:1 leather:1 knob:1 control:2 wrap:1 render:1 materi:1 stretch:1 stereo:1 auto:1 plant:1 car:1 decent:1 simpli:1 wheel:1 tuka:1 sake:1 ground:1 journo:1 reach:1 clean:1 hvac:1 joi:1 easili:1 rather:1 accent:1 audio:1 fiddli:1 hell:1 lazi:1 cry:1 human:1 spend:1 sit:1 differ:1 interfac:1 steer:1 deliv:1 radio:1 box:1 miss:1	||	Like the exterior, Hyundai's not stretching to break new ground with the interior. Spend some time in the hell-box interior of an xB and you'll cry tears of joy the first time you plant your tukas in the Accent. Rather than be different for the sake of it, Hyundai delivers a clean, simply operated human-car interface rendered in decent materials. The radio sits up high, easily reached, and just below it are three knobs for the HVAC - no fiddly rocker controls here. Because we're lazy auto journos, we missed audio controls on the leather wrapped steering wheel, but the stereo is	##false@@false$$	right there.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hyundai; interior; Hyundai; HVAC; 	NOUN: exterior; Hyundai; ground; interior; time; interior; xB; tears; joy; time; tukas; Accent; sake; Hyundai; interface; materials; radio; knobs; HVAC; rocker controls; auto journos; controls; leather; wheel; stereo; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
365489985 6 8----Interior----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	plastic:1 belong:1 simpl:1 ergonom:1 overal:1 halfwai:1 door:2 gaug:1 show:1 bracket:1 though:1 spot:1 expect:1 open:1 cover:1 becom:1 seat:2 midpack:1 right:3 control:1 decad:1 econo:1 support:1 thankfulli:1 class:1 faultless:1 warranti:1 bargain:1 luster:1 non:1 sampler:1 sign:1 upholsteri:1 touch:2 packag:1 dress:1 materi:1 bin:1 cheap:1 low:1 car:2 decent:1 panel:2 fare:1 run:1 add:1 upper:1 area:1 cockpit:1 cloth:1 driver:1 mar:1 especi:1 scratch:1 feel:1 endur:1 rear:1 front:1 quickli:1 tast:1 richer:1 flimsi:1 dash:1 pattern:1 bolster:1 insid:1 alreadi:1 wear:1	||	The seats are econo-car fare, though bolstered halfway decently and supportive in the right spots. Cloth upholstery in two tasteful patterns should endure at least until the warranty runs out in a decade. There are touches of bargain bin inside, however. The seat brackets, especially for the rears, are right out in the open, not dressed in like on some other cars, which adds a touch of cheap. The door panels are made of a plastic that will quickly become marred with scratches, too. Our sampler was already showing signs of wear in this area. Overall, materials are midpack for the class, with low-luster coverings on the dash and upper door panels, non-flimsy controls, and faultless ergonomics. It's a richer feeling cockpit than you'd expect, and the simple gauge package is thankfully where it belongs, right in front of the driver.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: seats; fare; spots; Cloth upholstery; patterns; warranty; decade; touches; bargain bin; seat brackets; rears; cars; touch; door panels; plastic; scratches; sampler; signs; wear; area; materials; midpack; class; coverings; dash; door panels; controls; ergonomics; feeling cockpit; gauge package; front; driver; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
365489985 6 9----DriveRide----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	kick:1 cabl:1 entertain:1 good:2 transaxl:1 honest:1 torqu:1 overs:1 cylind:1 aluminum:1 drive:1 precis:1 chunki:1 ft:1 happili:1 ring:1 liter:1 respons:1 wire:1 favorit:1 far:1 dai:1 piec:1 without:1 pedal:1 powertrain:1 machin:1 throttl:1 latenc:1 lb:2 press:1 model:1 can:1 slightli:1 convers:1 gravel:1 bellow:1 hand:1 mildli:1 layout:1 setup:1 horsepow:1 accent:1 valv:1 actuat:1 bear:1 ridicul:1 feel:1 speed:1 lockout:1 voic:1 dohc:1 startlingli:1 featur:1 shifter:1 channel:1	||	Hyundai's 1.6-liter four-cylinder kicks it with a DOHC 16-valve layout and a slightly gravel voice that'll happily bellow all day. 110 horsepower and 106 lb-ft of torque have 2,500 lbs to bear, and when channeled through the five-speed transaxle, the Accent can even be mildly entertaining. The shifter isn't a model of precision, but the startlingly chunky setup OEM'd by B&M feels good in the hand and the ridiculously oversized machined aluminum lockout ring is a conversation piece. Our favorite powertrain feature by far was the honest-to-goodness throttle cable. No drive by wire actuation here; press the pedal and you get a response without latency.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hyundai; 	NOUN: Hyundai; DOHC; layout; voice; day; horsepower; lb-ft; torque; lbs; transaxle; Accent; shifter; model; precision; setup OEM; B&M; hand; aluminum lockout ring; conversation piece; powertrain feature; throttle cable; drive; wire actuation; pedal; response; latency; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
365489985 6 10----DriveRide----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	sporti:2 rack:1 harsh:1 though:1 volkswagen:1 disc:1 time:1 hyundai:1 motion:1 dynam:1 move:1 wind:1 wrap:1 fling:1 rubber:1 suppl:1 honor:1 se:4 tune:1 without:1 pedal:1 alloi:1 bodi:1 hatch:1 torsion:1 bar:1 got:1 rabbit:1 ride:1 underst:1 neck:1 ultim:1 combo:1 ingredi:1 spring:1 grin:1 stiction:1 rate:1 exercis:1 drum:1 accent:4 brake:1 platter:1 confid:1 inch:1 check:1 manag:1 firm:2 traction:1 front:1 recip:1 scruff:1 stabil:1 shock:1 around:1 suspens:1 specif:2 chassi:1 steer:1 macstrut:1 beam:1 plenti:2 stuf:1 part:1 keep:2	||	A sporty suspension tune is also part of the SE up-rating. MacStruts up front and a torsion beam out back are time honored ingredients for the sporty hatch recipe. Hyundai stuffed plenty of rubber under the Accent SE, wrapping the 16-inch alloys with 205s for plenty of stiction. SE-specific springs and shocks keep body motions in check while you're flinging the Accent SE around by the scruff of its neck, exercising the model's specific steering rack and stabilizer bar. Even with a disc/drum combo platter, the brake pedal is firm and confident. And while the Accent ultimately understeers, it's got the moves and the traction to keep you grinning. The ride winds up being firm without being harsh, though the Accent can't manage the supple chassis dynamics of a Volkswagen Rabbit.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hyundai; Volkswagen Rabbit; 	NOUN: suspension tune; part; SE up-rating; MacStruts; front; torsion beam; time; ingredients; hatch recipe; Hyundai; plenty; rubber; Accent SE; alloys; 205s; plenty; stiction; springs; shocks; body motions; check; Accent SE; scruff; neck; model; rack; stabilizer bar; disc\/drum combo platter; brake pedal; Accent; moves; traction; ride winds; firm; Accent; chassis dynamics; Volkswagen Rabbit; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
365489985 6 11----Verdict----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:1 car:1 mpg:3 acheiv:1 highwai:2 epa:1 though:1 fit:1 staff:1 rate:1 seat:1 fuel:1 driver:1 accent:4 heavi:1 whatev:1 happili:1 dandi:1 hatchback:1 work:1 disappoint:1 everyth:1 franchis:1 respons:1 sharp:1 bulki:1 speed:1 rear:1 us:1 se:1 adult:1 win:1 like:1 flexibl:1 stai:1 materi:1 nba:1 commut:1 item:1 economi:1 construct:1 plenti:1 citi:1 daili:1 haul:1	||	Sharp responses aren't everything, and the Accent works just dandy as a daily driver, too. Adults will fit in the rear seats, though the Accent will likely not be the staff car of an NBA franchise. Hatchbacks have winning flexibility, and the Accent happily hauled plenty of bulky items, construction materials or whatever for us. One disappointment during the Accent's stay was fuel economy. While the EPA rates the Accent SE at 27 mpg city and 33 mpg highway when equipped with the 5-speed, we only acheived 27.5 mpg with a highway-heavy commute.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: NBA; EPA; 	NOUN: responses; everything; Accent; driver; Adults; seats; Accent; staff car; NBA franchise; Hatchbacks; flexibility; Accent; plenty; items; construction materials; disappointment; Accent; stay; fuel economy; EPA rates; Accent SE; mpg city; mpg highway; 5-speed; mpg; commute; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Accent has a high roofline defined on either side by black rubber rain gutters, while the windshield blends into the front of the roof without any visible trim. 365489985 6 52----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	stick:1 mpg:2 lower:1 slightli:1 gener:1 test:1 overal:1 highwai:1 automat:2 real:1 estim:1 versu:1 gear:1 drive:1 snappier:1 fuel:1 cruis:1 year:1 accent:1 top:1 respons:1 speed:1 rememb:1 figur:1 exchang:1 comparison:1 procedur:1 manual:3 throttl:1 ratio:1 better:2 deliv:1 poorer:1 economi:1 low:1 citi:1 latest:1 make:1 previou:1 shift:1 design:1 reflect:1 world:1	||	The EPA's latest City/Highway fuel economy estimates are 27/32 mpg for the manual, 24/33 mpg for the automatic. When making comparisons, remember that 2008 figures are generally lower (poorer) than in previous years because of new test procedures designed to better reflect real-world driving. The automatic does slightly better than the manual because its overall top gear ratio is a low 2.77:1, versus 3.39:1 for the manual. In exchange, the stick-shift Accent should deliver snappier throttle response from cruising speeds.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: EPA; 	DATE: 2008; 	NOUN: EPA; City\/Highway fuel economy estimates; mpg; manual; mpg; comparisons; figures; years; test procedures; driving; manual; gear ratio; manual; exchange; stick-shift Accent; throttle response; speeds; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

365489985 6 54----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	ride:1 sporti:1 model:2 percent:3 beef:1 rack:1 vs:1 sprung:1 upgrad:1 roll:2 level:1 rate:1 strut:1 firmer:1 hyundai:1 valv:1 feel:1 mm:2 corner:1 anti:1 coup:2 rear:1 front:2 resist:1 se:1 tune:1 sidewal:1 tread:1 tire:1 lean:1 suspens:2 differ:2 wider:1 bodi:1 gl:2 tighter:1 ratio:1 sedan:1 steer:1 stiffli:1 stiffer:1 gs:2 bar:2 make:1	||	The SE coupe is more stiffly sprung than the GS coupe or GLS sedan (by 24 percent up front and 11 percent in the rear). Its suspension struts are valved tighter, and its front anti-roll bar is beefed up to 24 mm, vs. the 21 mm bar on the GS/GLS. And the SE's V-rated tires have stiffer sidewalls and wider treads, which makes for a firmer ride. The steering ratio is the same (15.5:1) in all three models, but Hyundai says all three racks are tuned differently for different levels of sporty feel, while the SE's suspension upgrades make it 70 percent more resistant to body roll so it leans less in corners than the other models.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Hyundai; 	NOUN: SE coupe; GS coupe; GLS sedan; percent; front; percent; rear; suspension struts; bar; mm; mm bar; GS\/GLS; SE; tires; sidewalls; treads; ride; ratio; models; Hyundai; racks; levels; feel; SE; suspension upgrades; percent; body roll; corners; models; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

365489985 3 14----Price----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mold:1 can:1 wheel:1 player:1 wiper:1 desir:1 add:1 mirror:1 sunroof:1 power:1 cruis:1 accent:1 along:1 trim:3 leather:1 conveni:1 option:2 sportiest:1 hatchback:1 control:1 includ:1 inch:1 spoiler:1 entri:1 premium:1 larger:1 lock:1 rear:2 foglight:1 sport:1 se:2 tune:1 satellit:1 much:2 suspens:1 alloi:1 bodi:1 window:1 packag:1 color:1 remot:1 featur:2 radio:1 gs:1 act:1 intermitt:1 found:1 cd:1	||	The SE hatchback acts as the premium trim here, with power windows, locks, and mirrors, remote entry, leather trim, a CD/MP3 player with satellite radio, and an intermittent rear wiper. It's also the sportiest Accent. Along with its sport-tuned suspension, it adds foglights, a rear spoiler, larger 16-inch alloy wheels, and body-colored moldings. Much of the SE's features can be found in the optional Convenience Package. New options for 2009 include a sunroof for the SE and the much desired cruise control feature for all but the GS trim.	##false@@false$$		||	DATE: 2009; 	LOCATION: GS; 	NOUN: SE hatchback; premium; power windows; locks; entry; leather; CD\/MP3 player; satellite radio; wiper; Accent; suspension; foglights; spoiler; alloy wheels; moldings; SE; features; Package; New options; sunroof; SE; cruise control feature; GS; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

365489985 5 13----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 person:1 stick:1 drove:1 singl:1 next:1 higher:1 pain:1 express:1 issu:1 though:1 expect:1 real:1 throw:1 reach:1 sore:1 releas:1 gear:1 clutch:1 driver:1 stuck:1 hard:1 right:1 clunk:1 liter:1 get:2 us:1 tradit:1 much:1 broken:1 huge:1 pattern:1 elbow:1 take:1 commut:1 mid:1 comment:1 posit:1 shifter:1 shift:2	||	The clutch itself takes some getting used to, releasing much higher than most drivers would expect. The real issue, though, is the shifter. Every single person who drove this car commented on it with pained expressions. After a long commute, my right elbow was sore from all the hard shifting.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: clutch; drivers; issue; shifter; shift; gears; clunk; stick; mid-throw; position; H pattern; person; car; expressions; commute; elbow; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Pricing for the 2010 models starts at the same low 9,970 price of the 2009 base model and both come without air conditioning or a stereo. Automakers often put well-optioned cars into their press fleets in order to coddle us journalists into writing a nicer review. But the Accent that Hyundai supplied for this test was the actual base-model Accent. No air conditioning, no radio, no nothin'. (Well, except for a 95 set of floor mats, but those don't really count.) Even Nissan slipped air conditioning and antilock brakes into the Versa 1.6 I tested. 365489985 8 13----Safety----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 yari:1 govern:1 test:4 highest:1 accept:1 score:3 good:1 highwai:1 toyota:1 impact:4 airbag:3 fit:1 passeng:2 rate:2 area:1 frontal:1 insur:1 side:5 seat:1 realist:1 electron:1 accent:3 institut:1 brake:1 crash:2 versa:1 control:1 safeti:2 standard:1 worst:1 poor:1 rear:1 star:2 front:3 avail:1 bad:1 stabil:1 row:1 curtain:1 honda:1 mount:1 kinda:1 fall:1 ac:1 actual:1 antilock:1	||	Safety is the one area where the Accent falls down. Front-seat-mounted side airbags and two-row side curtain airbags are standard, but antilock brakes aren't available, nor is electronic stability control. And the Accent's crash test scores aren't very good. Actually, they're kinda bad. In government tests, the Accent scored 5 out of 5 stars for front impact -- as do most new cars -- but side impact scores were 4 stars for front passengers and 3 for rear passengers. In the more realistic Insurance Institute for Highway Safety tests, the Accent is Acceptable (the second highest rating) for frontal impacts and Poor (the worst rating) for side impacts -- and that's with side airbags! The Versa 1.6 aced all of its crash tests, as did the Honda Fit and the Toyota Yaris.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Insurance Institute for Highway Safety; Honda; Toyota Yaris; 	NOUN: Safety; area; Accent; side airbags; side curtain airbags; brakes; stability control; Accent; crash test scores; government tests; Accent; stars; impact; cars; impact scores; stars; passengers; passengers; Insurance Institute; Highway Safety tests; Accent; rating; impacts; Poor; rating; side impacts; side airbags; Versa; crash tests; Honda Fit; Toyota Yaris; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

365489985 8 17----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 need:1 face:1 model:1 eventu:1 can:1 trade:1 test:2 reason:1 resal:1 score:2 door:1 someth:1 transmiss:1 automat:1 consid:1 help:1 given:1 seat:1 buyer:1 practic:1 import:1 valu:1 accent:1 crash:2 brake:1 option:2 plu:1 condit:1 versa:3 final:1 inexpens:1 list:1 factor:1 offer:2 sever:1 huge:1 trunk:1 plan:1 better:2 expens:1 air:1 em:1 bui:1 significantli:1 big:1 antilock:1 nicer:1	||	Why? Several reasons. First, the Versa is just more practical. It has four doors, a huge back seat, and a big trunk. The Versa has significantly better crash test scores, plus it offers antilock brakes as a 250 option; the Accent doesn't offer them at all. (And let's face it, given the Accent's crash test scores, it needs all the help it can get.) Air conditioning and an automatic transmission are also on the Versa's option list, and you don't have to buy a more-expensive model to get 'em. And finally, the Versa has better resale values -- an important factor to consider, since most buyers of inexpensive cars are planning to eventually trade up to something nicer.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: reasons; Versa; doors; seat; trunk; Versa; crash test scores; brakes; option; Accent; Accent; crash test scores; help; Air conditioning; transmission; Versa; option list; model; Versa; resale values; factor; buyers; cars; something; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

It's as ugly as the Accent is cute, its warranty is shorter, and you probably won't be able to negotiate as good a deal on it as you will on the Accent. Neither reason is enough to sway my recommendation. As much as I love the Accent -- as cute as it is, as enjoyable as it is, and as inexpensive as it is -- if you only have ten and a half grand to spend, you're still better off with a	##false@@false$$	Nissan Versa 1.6	##false@@true$$	. 276380073 1 1----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 call:1 idea:1 axl:1 bright:1 gener:1 give:1 amg:1 engin:1 inde:1 perform:1 shoehorn:1 run:1 quit:1 king:1 someth:1 worri:1 super:1 time:1 goodi:1 buck:1 hill:1 corvett:1 cadillac:2 folk:1 merced:1 rear:1 pronounc:1 variou:1 number:1 arrai:1 ct:3 tradit:1 prime:1 product:1 slap:1 acceler:1 sedan:2 impress:1 wai:1 rel:1 low:1 fast:1 hop:1 readi:1 afford:1	||	Back when the first-generation CTS was still in production, the folks at Cadillac had a bright idea: Shoehorn a Corvette engine into the CTS, slap on an array of go-fast goodies and give the traditional kings of the super-sedan hill -- BMW's M5, Mercedes-Benz's various AMG sedans and Audi's S6 -- something to worry about. The 2009 Cadillac CTS-V, based on the vastly superior second-generation CTS platform, ditches the axle hop, gets a first-rate interior and -- perhaps most importantly -- achieves record-breaking four-door speed. The 556-horsepower, supercharged 6.2-liter V8 (which is essentially a slightly detuned version of the same motor found in the Corvette ZR-1) helps the new V put down some ridiculous straight-line times: zero to 60 mph in 4.3 seconds and the quarter-mile in 12.4 seconds at nearly 115 mph. Moreover, the CTS-V is equally impressive when the going gets twisty. In a recent comparison test, we found out for ourselves what Cadillac had been telling us all along -- the V is quicker than both the M5 and the C63 AMG around a racetrack, despite a base price that's nearly 25,000 less than the BMW.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Cadillac CTS-V; Cadillac; AMG; BMW; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: year; ballgame; Cadillac CTS-V; CTS platform; axle hop; interior; speed; V8; version; motor; Corvette ZR-1; V; times; mph; seconds; quarter-mile; seconds; mph; CTS-V; comparison test; Cadillac; V; M5; C63 AMG; racetrack; base price; BMW; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Second, the automatic transmission can feel crude at times, thanks to a slow-witted manual mode and rough upshifts in both Sport Drive and manual modes. In performance testing, an automatic-equipped CTS-V catapulted to 60 mph in 4.3 seconds and flew through the quarter-mile in 12.4 seconds at 114.7 mph. Fortunately, the CTS boasts one of the nicer interiors in its segment, with a sleekly attractive center stack design and mostly high-quality materials. We'd advise skipping the base seats, as they're neither supportive nor particularly comfortable. Get the optional Recaro sport seats instead, which are snug in all the right places, yet comfy enough for longer journeys. Backseat dimensions are satisfactory, even for larger adults. The regular CTS's available split-folding rear seat isn't available on the CTS-V, though a pass-through is standard. The trunk offers 13.6 cubic feet of cargo space, although loading of larger items is hampered by a short deck.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: CTS; Recaro; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: CTS-V; interior; CTS; CTS; interiors; segment; center; design; materials; base seats; Recaro sport seats; places; journeys; Backseat dimensions; adults; CTS; seat; CTS-V; trunk; feet; cargo space; loading; items; deck; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

276380073 1 17----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	hors:1 otherworldli:1 perform:2 lenient:1 though:1 mass:1 time:1 although:1 hide:1 astound:1 button:1 drive:2 light:1 plu:1 turn:1 wind:1 control:3 effort:1 competit:1 ct:3 much:1 weigh:1 bit:1 default:1 sedan:1 program:1 tap:1 make:1 pound:1 face:1 weight:1 ultim:1 remedi:1 switch:1 road:2 activ:1 mode:1 flatten:1 straighten:1 twice:1 suv:1 easili:1 ton:1 lap:1 hurri:1 feel:1 corner:1 aggress:1 cadillac:1 traction:2 sport:1 portli:1 crossov:1 despit:1 stabil:1 steer:2 tight:1 amend:1	||	At 4,313 pounds, the 2009 Cadillac CTS-V weighs as much as some crossover SUVs. This makes its face-flattening performance all the more astounding. Despite otherworldly lap times, though, the CTS-V ultimately can't hide its 2-ton-plus mass on winding roads. The CTS-V feels a bit portly in tight corners, although those 556 horses make amends in a hurry when the road straightens out. The default steering effort is too light for a high-performance sport sedan, but that's easily remedied by tapping the traction control button twice -- this activates Competitive Driving Mode, which weights up the steering, turns off traction control and switches to a more lenient stability control program for aggressive driving.	##false@@false$$		||	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: pounds; Cadillac CTS-V; crossover SUVs; performance; lap times; CTS-V; mass; roads; CTS-V; bit; corners; horses; amends; hurry; road; default; effort; sport sedan; traction control button; Mode; weights; steering; traction control; stability control program; driving; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

276380073 12 8----DriveRide----#text.P.SPAN.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	car:1 stori:1 can:1 engin:2 half:1 torqu:1 brute:1 poni:1 gear:1 sell:1 rpm:2 horsepow:1 import:2 especi:1 ft:1 forc:1 lsa:1 top:1 liter:1 categori:1 supercharg:1 speed:1 matter:1 cadillac:1 isn:1 come:1 number:2 produc:1 monstrou:1 avail:1 either:1 acceler:1 eas:1 compliant:1 lb:2	||	One of the most important categories, especially when it comes to what sells a car, is the all important horsepower number. That number, however, isn t half the story, as the V s engine produces a monstrous 551 ft-lbs of torque at 3800 rpm. Not only will this make for a smoother driving experience, we re certain it will help prolong the life of the tranny. From either the front or rear, the 2009 Cadillac CTS-V has a boxy, angular appearance, though the cues soften in the middle with smoother doorlines and handles. Design details abound, including recessed, jewel-like headlamps, meshlike upper and lower grilles, a well-sculpted front fascia, and integrated fog lamps in front. From the side, the CTS-V has a relatively high beltline that rises to a high decklid in back, where stylish vertical tail lamps flank the corners and lid crease is lined with a spoilerlike strip of LEDs. Flashy 19-inch wheels, polished or painted, have V-shaped spoke segments and showcase the heavy-duty Brembo brake hardware.
