276380073 7 4----DriveRide----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	tremec:1 relax:1 substanti:1 door:1 torqu:1 though:1 obviou:1 outmatch:1 rpm:3 ft:3 hood:1 thunder:1 respons:1 sibl:1 number:1 avail:1 fun:1 luster:1 row:1 ct:3 palm:1 commut:1 bmw:1 lb:3 town:1 low:1 output:1 compar:1 rev:1 caddi:1 fashion:1 nestl:1 can:1 amg:1 road:1 automat:1 thoroughli:1 mode:1 six:1 pleas:1 versu:1 sell:1 driven:1 horsepow:1 corvett:1 speed:1 happi:1 cadillac:1 merced:1 track:1 sport:1 choic:1 true:1 offer:1 around:2 manual:1 point:1 lose:1 either:1 offic:1 cog:1 twist:1 benz:1 competitor:1 grunt:2 shift:1	||	This Caddy thunders down the road with 556 horsepower and 551 lb-ft of torque, with most of that twist available around 1,500 rpm. Compared to the CTS-V's most obvious competitors the BMW M5 and Mercedes-Benz AMG E63 that low-down grunt is a selling point. And while the Bimmer's rev-happy V10 is fun on the track, it loses its luster when commuting to the office. And though it's true that the E63 offers substantially more grunt than the M5 (465 lb-ft at 5,200 rpm versus 383 lb-ft at 6,100 rpm), it's still outmatched in both output and responsiveness by the CTS-V. The Cadillac, like its two-door Corvette sibling, can be driven around town in a thoroughly relaxed fashion. And with a choice of either a six-speed automatic with sport and manual shift modes or a row-your-own Tremec with the same number of cogs, the CTS-V pleases with what's under the hood and what's nestled in your palm.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Mercedes-Benz AMG; Cadillac; Corvette; 	NOUN: Caddy; road; horsepower; lb-ft; torque; twist; rpm; CTS-V; competitors; BMW M5; Mercedes-Benz AMG E63; grunt; selling point; Bimmer; V10; fun; track; luster; office; E63; grunt; M5; lb-ft; rpm; lb-ft; rpm; output; responsiveness; CTS-V; Cadillac; Corvette sibling; town; fashion; choice; sport; manual shift modes; Tremec; number; cogs; CTS-V; hood; palm; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

276380073 7 9----DriveRide----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	bend:1 electr:1 rheolog:1 center:1 particl:1 damp:1 fluid:2 button:1 rang:1 magneto:1 impregn:1 final:1 respons:1 delphi:1 pockmark:1 wide:1 ct:1 system:1 appli:1 sourc:1 stack:1 fast:1 readi:1 viscos:1 thing:1 ride:1 result:1 allow:1 road:2 adapt:1 build:1 automat:1 iron:1 oil:1 damper:1 rate:1 floati:1 current:1 aplomb:1 forc:1 elicit:1 mr:1 speed:1 firm:1 task:1 later:1 fill:1 us:1 shock:1 begin:1 handl:1 suspens:1 tighten:1 chang:1 magnet:1	||	When the roads finally begin to bend, the CTS-V is more than ready to take up the task. The Delphi-sourced magnetic adaptive damping system allows for a wide range of suspension rates, eliciting fast responses by using shocks filled with magneto-rheological fluid (an oil impregnated with iron particles) that changes viscosity when an electric current is applied. The result is a fluid	##false@@false$$	not	##false@@false$$	floaty ride that handles the most pockmarked roads with aplomb. As speeds and lateral forces build, the dampers automatically tighten up and the MR button on the center stack firms things up even further.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: roads; CTS-V; task; system; range; suspension rates; responses; shocks; fluid; oil; iron particles; viscosity; current; result; fluid; ride; roads; aplomb; speeds; forces; dampers; MR button; center; firms things; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The brakes work beautifully, with a firm pedal feel, linear responses and fade-free performance. -1218218989 10 11----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	equip:1 poplar:1 wood:1 door:1 seat:4 aluminum:1 drive:1 cayman:1 year:1 inlin:1 option:3 form:1 avail:1 curtain:1 system:3 price:1 upholsteri:2 packag:3 split:1 arriv:1 audi:1 america:1 wheel:1 rival:1 bucket:1 engin:3 line:1 run:1 spring:1 transmiss:1 six:3 seater:1 side:2 sunroof:1 initi:1 turbocharg:1 later:1 front:3 voic:1 interior:2 sporti:1 perform:1 heat:1 earli:1 verit:1 cylind:1 compact:1 antiskid:1 power:2 leather:2 control:1 liter:1 coup:4 favorit:1 flat:1 assist:1 fan:1 tire:1 size:1 bmw:2 got:1 burl:1 antilock:1 model:5 seri:4 bill:1 convert:1 north:1 navig:1 activ:1 automat:1 airbag:2 share:1 order:1 horsepow:2 volvo:1 develop:1 slot:1 trim:3 brake:1 hatchback:1 top:1 safeti:1 includ:4 standard:3 inch:2 speed:2 premium:3 walnut:1 rear:2 traction:1 sport:4 produc:1 came:1 fold:2 soft:1 manual:1 suspens:1 specif:1 featur:1 ad:1 descend:1 porsch:1	||	Billed as a veritable descendant of the 2002 series of the 1970s, a favorite of early-BMW fans, the 2008 BMW 1-Series line was new to North America. Slotting below BMW's 3-Series in both size and price, these compact premium sporty/performance rear-wheel-drive models came in 128i and 135i form. Both models were initially available, in spring 2008, as a two-door coupe. Convertibles with a power-folding soft top arrived later in the 2008 model year. Rivals included the Audi A3 hatchback, Porsche Cayman two-seater, and Volvo C30. Their 3.0-liter inline six-cylinder engines were shared with the 3-Series. The 128i engine developed 230 horsepower, while the 135i got a turbocharged engine that produced 300 horsepower. All models had a standard six-speed manual transmission, but could be equipped with an optional six-speed automatic. Standard safety features included antilock brakes, traction control, an antiskid system, curtain side airbags (coupes only), and front side airbags. A sunroof, split-folding rear seat, and poplar wood interior trim were standard in coupes. All models had run-flat tires: 17-inch on the 128i and 18-inch on the 135i. Coupes could have optional Premium and Sport packages. The Premium Package included leather upholstery, a power front seat, and BMW's Assist system. Ordering a Sport Package added specific trim, a sport suspension (on 128i), and sport bucket seats. Other options included a voice-activated navigation system, aluminum or burled walnut interior trim, leather upholstery, and heated front seats.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: BMW; Audi; Porsche; Volvo; BMW; Sport Package; 	DATE: 2002; 2008; 2008; 2008; 	LOCATION: North America; 	NOUN: descendant; series; 1970s; favorite; fans; BMW 1-Series line; North America; BMW; 3-Series; size; price; premium; models; 128i; 135i; models; spring; coupe; Convertibles; model year; Rivals; Audi A3 hatchback; Porsche Cayman two-seater; Volvo C30; inline six-cylinder engines; 3-Series; engine; horsepower; 135i; engine; horsepower; models; six-speed manual transmission; six-speed; Standard safety features; brakes; traction control; system; curtain side airbags; coupes; side airbags; sunroof; seat; wood; coupes; models; tires; 128i; 135i; Coupes; Premium; Sport packages; Premium Package; leather upholstery; power; seat; BMW; Assist system; Sport Package; sport suspension; 128i; sport bucket seats; options; navigation system; aluminum; walnut interior; leather upholstery; seats; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1934760915 6 43----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	via:1 engin:1 carri:1 re:1 six:1 gear:1 electron:1 wonder:1 adjust:1 rpm:1 rather:1 slot:1 sens:1 kit:1 direct:1 softwar:1 speed:1 gearbox:2 manufactur:1 piec:1 tri:1 manual:1 bodi:1 compon:1 throttl:1 mechan:1 intern:1 ecu:1 tweak:1 within:1 clever:1	||	It s a clever piece of kit, and it s a wonder more manufacturers have not tried it. Rather than being a mechanical component within the gearbox, it s a software tweak to the ECU that senses what gear you re about to slot in and adjusts engine rpm via the electronic throttle bodies. Internally, the 370Z s six-speed manual gearbox is a direct carry-over from the 350Z.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: piece; kit; wonder; manufacturers; component; gearbox; software; ECU; senses; gear; slot; engine rpm; throttle bodies; 370Z; manual gearbox; carry-over; 350Z; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

There s now even a glove box. The accelerator pedal is floor mounted, and its travel feels freer and more linear. The steering wheel is asymmetrical, neither circular nor oval, but its size and grip are perfect. Although the wheel is adjustable for rake alone, the entire IP moves along for the ride, assuring a clear shot at the gauges. The driver s seat is more aggressively bolstered than the passenger s, and both are upholstered in nonslip fabric. It s a tight fit, with the more globularly hipped among us contemplating the possibility of embarrassing chafing. The size of the shift knob, the pedals placement, the three big HVAC controls all represent an ergonomic hat trick. What s more, the monstrous cross support aft of the seats, which nearly bifurcated the cargo area, is now replaced by a simple aluminum tube that does minimal damage to storage space.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: HVAC; 	NOUN: cockpit; predecessor s; stitching; kneepad; center console; leather panel; hole; t order; nav system; glove box; accelerator pedal; floor; travel; wheel; size; grip; wheel; rake; IP moves; ride; shot; driver; seat; passenger s; fabric; fit; possibility; chafing; size; shift knob; pedals placement; HVAC; hat trick; s; cross support aft; seats; cargo area; aluminum tube; damage; storage space; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Forget everything you knew about the questionable 350Z interior the 370Z is nice enough to wear an Infiniti badge. Top rate upholstery, plastics, and synthetics exist in abundance within the cozy cockpit. There is storage (or an optional NAV system) above the audio system. The three-pod IP, with three more gauges center-mounted high on the dash, is just about perfect. Unfortunately, the earned grade drops two full letters with the inclusion of that terrible fuel/coolant temperature mess on the far left. The cabin accommodates two with abundant legroom, headroom, and shoulder room. The steering wheel is meaty, and all controls fall readily to hand without a hint awkwardness. Our tested was lightly optioned (at 34,055 it was only fitted with the sport package, floor mats, and splash guards), yet it didn't feel stripped-down or budget-rate. From the driver's seat, the only real drawback outward visibility is blamed on the exterior styling. The view of the outside world is hampered by the massive C-pillars just behind the ears, the tiny slit of a rear window, and the oversized exterior mirrors that seem to occupy more than their share of the front quarter visibility. -1934760915 7 4----Verdict----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	craft:1 send:1 test:1 infin:1 etc:1 door:1 torqu:1 powerpl:2 meati:1 independ:1 aluminum:3 power:1 ft:2 lug:1 hood:3 limit:1 doubl:1 throughout:1 wrap:1 rubber:1 coup:1 wishbon:1 avail:1 attract:1 subfram:1 tire:1 viscou:1 alloi:2 configur:1 multi:1 auto:1 hatch:1 lightweight:1 lb:2 pound:2 model:1 hp:2 boast:1 oem:1 weight:2 hundr:1 nestl:1 wheel:3 link:1 beautifulli:1 vq:1 transmiss:1 push:1 six:1 fit:1 rate:2 ident:1 extens:1 setup:1 forg:1 kept:2 corner:1 check:1 speed:2 rear:4 slip:1 us:1 front:2 sever:1 around:1 familiar:1 manual:1 suspens:1 sit:1 rai:1 seven:1 compon:1 differenti:1	||	Nestled under the alloy hood of the 370Z is another one of Nissan's familiar VQ powerplants: the all-aluminum VQ37VHR. In Z configuration, it's rated at 332 hp and 270 lb-ft of torque (the identical powerplant under the hood of the G37 is rated at 330 hp and 270 lb-ft, but the Infiniti coupe lugs around another several hundred pounds of weight). Our test model was fitted with a six-speed manual transmission (a seven-speed auto is available) sending power to the rear wheels through a viscous limited-slip differential. An aluminum double-wishbone suspension sits up front, while the rear wheels are kept in check through an independent multi-link setup. Four beautifully-crafted lightweight forged RAYS wheels some of the most attractive alloy from any OEM are pushed into each corner. The fronts are wrapped in 245/40-19 tires, with the rears boast meaty 275/35-19 rubber. An extensive use of aluminum throughout (hood, doors, rear hatch, subframe components, etc...) has kept weight down to about 3,250 pounds.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; RAYS; 	NOUN: alloy hood; 370Z; Nissan; VQ powerplants; VQ37VHR; Z configuration; hp; lb-ft; torque; powerplant; hood; G37; hp; lb-ft; Infiniti coupe lugs; pounds; weight; test model; manual transmission; auto; power; wheels; aluminum; suspension; front; wheels; check; setup; RAYS wheels; alloy; OEM; corner; fronts; tires; rears; rubber; use; aluminum; hood; doors; hatch; subframe components; weight; pounds; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 7 5----DriveRide----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 nail:1 reengag:1 put:1 stick:1 singl:1 decis:1 blip:1 engin:1 occasion:1 uncanni:1 highwai:1 abil:1 automat:1 transmiss:2 greatli:1 kind:1 intestin:1 gear:1 precis:1 clutch:1 synchrorev:1 move:1 speed:2 exactli:1 erron:1 suppos:1 mayb:1 empti:1 manual:2 simplifi:1 system:1 throttl:1 downshift:2 larg:1 featur:1 flawlessli:1 match:1 scare:1 shift:1	||	The 370Z features the first-of-its-kind, and all-new, SynchroRev Match system for the manual transmission. Greatly simplified, the throttle is automatically blipped, putting the engine speed precisely where it needs to be when the clutch is reengaged during downshifts. While it does make an occasional erroneous decision (move the stick shift above second gear at highway speeds and it will scare your large intestines empty), its ability to nail every single downshift flawlessly is uncanny. It does exactly what it is supposed to do the manual transmission... but... maybe it shouldn't?	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: 370Z; SynchroRev Match system; transmission; throttle; engine speed; clutch; downshifts; decision; stick shift; gear; highway speeds; intestines; ability; downshift; transmission; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 7 6----DriveRide----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	exoner:1 aka:1 kilter:1 apprehens:1 draw:1 obviou:1 time:2 button:1 among:1 longer:1 begrudgingli:1 none:1 effici:1 smile:1 control:1 thankfulli:1 third:1 pedal:1 tradit:1 frankli:1 bit:1 system:1 touch:1 skill:1 sigh:1 brilliant:1 match:2 automot:1 virtual:1 defeat:1 rev:1 smooth:1 ground:1 line:1 quit:1 someth:1 transmiss:3 automat:1 consid:1 slush:1 grin:1 mai:1 electron:1 fuel:1 left:1 caught:1 sprint:1 sacr:1 complet:1 microchip:1 kept:1 look:1 hone:1 standard:1 quicker:1 matter:1 encroach:1 us:1 seem:1 technolog:1 manual:3 elitist:1 replac:1 box:1 nissan:1 untouch:1 shift:1	||	Quite frankly, something seems just a bit off kilter. The standard transmission elitists among us begrudgingly smiled as the electronically-controlled slush box caught up to the smoothness of a well-shifted manual. We looked the other way when it matched the manual's fuel efficiency and kept grinning even when it was obvious that an automatic could be quicker in a sprint. None of this mattered, as our traditional third-pedal manual transmission was left virtually untouched. Now, this brilliant new automotive technology is encroaching on sacred ground by replacing a time-honed skill (aka rev-matching) with a microchip. Is this no longer considered a "manual" transmission? Where do we draw the line? With a sigh of apprehension, we'll exonerate Nissan this time as the system may be completely defeated at the touch of a button thankfully.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	NOUN: something; bit; kilter; transmission elitists; slush box; smoothness; manual; way; manual; fuel efficiency; sprint; None; manual transmission; technology; ground; skill; microchip; manual; transmission; line; sigh; apprehension; Nissan; time; system; touch; button; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

As expected, it feels quicker than the 350Z. In our unofficial (and non-abusive) testing, we snapped off a 5.1 second run without much effort (our GT-R did 3.5 seconds flat with the identical testing equipment, but with launch control). The limited-slip rear end hooks up well, and a blinking shift light helps the driver stay out of redline above 7,500 RPM. -1934760915 7 8----Interior----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.ARTICLE.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mph:1 drone:1 minor:1 carpool:1 carri:1 nois:1 gripe:1 seat:1 forward:1 mile:1 reson:1 serious:1 move:1 extrem:1 pavement:1 inadequaci:1 wind:1 prove:1 everyth:1 shallow:1 coup:1 famili:1 bag:1 unfriendli:1 period:1 els:1 tire:1 system:1 frame:1 trunk:1 irrit:1 own:1 gt:1 go:1 cabin:1 roar:1 space:1 cargo:2 fit:1 mai:1 brace:1 driver:1 insul:1 asid:1 pinch:1 audio:1 speed:1 rear:1 capabl:1 deftli:1 drown:1 soft:1 handl:1 inher:1 blue:1 suit:1 nearli:1 daili:1 nissan:1 week:1	||	We put about 700 miles on the blue Z over a one-week period. Aside from the inherent inadequacies of owning a two-seat coupe with a family (the GT-R is a 2+2, so it deftly handles carpools in a pinch), the 370Z proved capable and well-suited as a daily driver with only a few minor irritations. First, while the cabin is well insulated from wind noise, it seriously resonates from tire drone. At speeds above 70 mph, or on any unfriendly pavement, the roar nearly drowns out the audio system. Our second gripe is with cargo space. While Nissan moved the rear cargo brace forward, the trunk is still extremely shallow. You may get a framed carry-on bag in there, but everything else will have to be soft if it's going to fit.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	NOUN: miles; Z; period; inadequacies; coupe; family; GT-R; carpools; pinch; 370Z; driver; irritations; cabin; wind noise; tire drone; speeds; mph; pavement; roar; system; gripe; cargo space; Nissan; cargo; trunk; carry-on bag; everything; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The engine makes a nice growl at idle, but it's quickly lost once the engine spools and the mechanical noises up front drown out the two resonators in the rear (we are still waiting for VQ-equipped Nissan product with an impressive exhaust note). Although it never lets us down, the VQ engine isn't known around these circles for smoothness either. This character trait is immediately apparent once the tach speeds past 4,500 rpm and the stick shift starts really trembling. By 6,000 rpm, it's vibrating like a blender full of margarita mix and square ice cubes. The VQ wins countless awards, but it will never be confused with a smooth-running inline- or flat-six.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	LOCATION: LA basin; 	NOUN: day trip; LA basin; Z; traffic; tachometer; amount; leg work; clutch; engine; growl; engine spools; noises; resonators; rear; Nissan product; exhaust note; VQ engine; circles; smoothness; character trait; tach speeds; rpm; stick shift; rpm; blender; margarita mix; ice cubes; VQ; awards; inline; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Whatever it is, Nissan needs to ensure they don't let it slip away as it adds a layer of confidence that is often absent in cars costing five-times as much. Bolted to an amazingly rigid platform, the non-adjustable Z suspension is tight, but there is still noticeable body roll in the corners and nose dive under braking (the Nissan would brush its lower splitter on the asphalt into a tight banked uphill turn). Under throttle, and with a slight flick of the wrist, the rear wheels can easily be coaxed to step out if the overly cautious stability control is switched off. -1934760915 8 4----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	craft:1 send:1 test:1 infin:1 etc:1 door:1 torqu:1 powerpl:2 meati:1 independ:1 aluminum:3 power:1 ft:2 lug:1 hood:3 limit:1 doubl:1 throughout:1 wrap:1 rubber:1 coup:1 wishbon:1 avail:1 attract:1 subfram:1 tire:1 viscou:1 alloi:2 configur:1 multi:1 auto:1 hatch:1 lightweight:1 lb:2 pound:2 model:1 hp:2 boast:1 oem:1 weight:2 hundr:1 nestl:1 wheel:3 link:1 beautifulli:1 vq:1 transmiss:1 push:1 six:1 fit:1 rate:2 ident:1 extens:1 setup:1 forg:1 kept:2 corner:1 check:1 speed:2 rear:4 slip:1 us:1 front:2 sever:1 around:1 familiar:1 manual:1 suspens:1 sit:1 rai:1 seven:1 compon:1 differenti:1	||	Nestled under the alloy hood of the 370Z is another one of Nissan's familiar VQ powerplants: the all-aluminum VQ37VHR. In Z configuration, it's rated at 332 hp and 270 lb-ft of torque (the identical powerplant under the hood of the G37 is rated at 330 hp and 270 lb-ft, but the Infiniti coupe lugs around another several hundred pounds of weight). Our test model was fitted with a six-speed manual transmission (a seven-speed auto is available) sending power to the rear wheels through a viscous limited-slip differential. An aluminum double-wishbone suspension sits up front, while the rear wheels are kept in check through an independent multi-link setup. Four beautifully-crafted lightweight forged RAYS wheels some of the most attractive alloy from any OEM are pushed into each corner. The fronts are wrapped in 245/40-19 tires, with the rears boast meaty 275/35-19 rubber. An extensive use of aluminum throughout (hood, doors, rear hatch, subframe components, etc...) has kept weight down to about 3,250 pounds.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; RAYS; 	NOUN: alloy hood; 370Z; Nissan; VQ powerplants; VQ37VHR; Z configuration; hp; lb-ft; torque; powerplant; hood; G37; hp; lb-ft; Infiniti coupe lugs; pounds; weight; test model; manual transmission; auto; power; wheels; aluminum; suspension; front; wheels; check; setup; RAYS wheels; alloy; OEM; corner; fronts; tires; rears; rubber; use; aluminum; hood; doors; hatch; subframe components; weight; pounds; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Greatly simplified, the throttle is automatically blipped, putting the engine speed precisely where it needs to be when the clutch is reengaged during downshifts. While it does make an occasional erroneous decision (move the stick shift above second gear at highway speeds and it will scare your large intestines empty), its ability to nail every single downshift flawlessly is uncanny. The standard transmission elitists among us begrudgingly smiled as the electronically-controlled slush box caught up to the smoothness of a well-shifted manual. We looked the other way when it matched the manual's fuel efficiency and kept grinning even when it was obvious that an automatic could be quicker in a sprint. None of this mattered, as our traditional third-pedal manual transmission was left virtually untouched. Now, this brilliant new automotive technology is encroaching on sacred ground by replacing a time-honed skill (aka rev-matching) with a microchip. Is this no longer considered a "manual" transmission? Where do we draw the line? With a sigh of apprehension, we'll exonerate Nissan this time as the system may be completely defeated at the touch of a button thankfully.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	NOUN: something; bit; kilter; transmission elitists; slush box; smoothness; manual; way; manual; fuel efficiency; sprint; None; manual transmission; technology; ground; skill; microchip; manual; transmission; line; sigh; apprehension; Nissan; time; system; touch; button; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

As expected, it feels quicker than the 350Z. In our unofficial (and non-abusive) testing, we snapped off a 5.1 second run without much effort (our GT-R did 3.5 seconds flat with the identical testing equipment, but with launch control). The limited-slip rear end hooks up well, and a blinking shift light helps the driver stay out of redline above 7,500 RPM. -1934760915 8 8----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	mph:1 drone:1 minor:1 carpool:1 carri:1 nois:1 gripe:1 seat:1 forward:1 mile:1 reson:1 serious:1 move:1 extrem:1 pavement:1 inadequaci:1 wind:1 prove:1 everyth:1 shallow:1 coup:1 famili:1 bag:1 unfriendli:1 period:1 els:1 tire:1 system:1 frame:1 trunk:1 irrit:1 own:1 gt:1 go:1 cabin:1 roar:1 space:1 cargo:2 fit:1 mai:1 brace:1 driver:1 insul:1 asid:1 pinch:1 audio:1 speed:1 rear:1 capabl:1 deftli:1 drown:1 soft:1 handl:1 inher:1 blue:1 suit:1 nearli:1 daili:1 nissan:1 week:1	||	We put about 700 miles on the blue Z over a one-week period. Aside from the inherent inadequacies of owning a two-seat coupe with a family (the GT-R is a 2+2, so it deftly handles carpools in a pinch), the 370Z proved capable and well-suited as a daily driver with only a few minor irritations. First, while the cabin is well insulated from wind noise, it seriously resonates from tire drone. At speeds above 70 mph, or on any unfriendly pavement, the roar nearly drowns out the audio system. Our second gripe is with cargo space. While Nissan moved the rear cargo brace forward, the trunk is still extremely shallow. You may get a framed carry-on bag in there, but everything else will have to be soft if it's going to fit.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	NOUN: miles; Z; period; inadequacies; coupe; family; GT-R; carpools; pinch; 370Z; driver; irritations; cabin; wind noise; tire drone; speeds; mph; pavement; roar; system; gripe; cargo space; Nissan; cargo; trunk; carry-on bag; everything; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 8 9----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 equip:1 squar:1 basin:1 circl:1 pull:1 award:1 nice:1 wait:1 amount:1 nois:1 although:1 spool:1 rpm:2 mile:1 inlin:1 tach:1 reson:1 trait:1 work:1 limit:1 prove:1 liter:1 charact:1 flat:1 vibrat:1 dai:1 countless:1 traffic:1 blender:1 start:1 growl:1 la:1 impress:1 cube:1 known:1 low:1 make:1 trembl:1 tachomet:1 realli:1 stick:1 lost:1 smooth:2 engin:3 run:1 across:1 vq:3 six:1 ic:1 full:1 clutch:1 immedi:1 margarita:1 trip:1 note:1 speed:1 let:1 appar:1 rear:1 front:1 us:1 win:1 past:1 quickli:1 confus:1 mix:1 drown:1 idl:1 around:1 product:1 leg:1 either:1 obligatori:1 comfort:1 mechan:1 exhaust:1 nissan:1 shift:1	||	During our obligatory 200-mile day trip across the LA basin, the Z proved comfortable in traffic as the 3.7-liter pulled from low on the tachometer, limiting the amount of leg work needed on the clutch. The engine makes a nice growl at idle, but it's quickly lost once the engine spools and the mechanical noises up front drown out the two resonators in the rear (we are still waiting for VQ-equipped Nissan product with an impressive exhaust note). Although it never lets us down, the VQ engine isn't known around these circles for smoothness either. This character trait is immediately apparent once the tach speeds past 4,500 rpm and the stick shift starts really trembling. By 6,000 rpm, it's vibrating like a blender full of margarita mix and square ice cubes. The VQ wins countless awards, but it will never be confused with a smooth-running inline- or flat-six.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	LOCATION: LA basin; 	NOUN: day trip; LA basin; Z; traffic; tachometer; amount; leg work; clutch; engine; growl; engine spools; noises; resonators; rear; Nissan product; exhaust note; VQ engine; circles; smoothness; character trait; tach speeds; rpm; stick shift; rpm; blender; margarita mix; ice cubes; VQ; awards; inline; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 8 10----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 absent:1 highwai:1 open:1 time:1 absenc:1 credit:1 whatev:1 trait:1 number:1 wide:1 tune:1 cost:1 tire:1 much:1 near:1 often:1 lift:1 amaz:1 lot:1 low:1 wheelbas:1 straight:1 thing:1 car:2 awai:1 line:1 add:1 consid:1 ensur:1 short:1 stabl:1 assess:1 confid:1 park:1 corner:1 speed:1 let:1 drag:1 slip:1 layer:1 true:1 know:1 stabil:1 sit:1 chassi:1 exhaust:1 nissan:1 found:1	||	At open highway speeds, the 370Z is more stable than most cars are sitting still in a parking lot. It's an amazing trait considering the short wheelbase and wide tires. We don't know if credit goes to the low drag numbers, near absence of lift, or the exhaustive chassis tuning. Whatever it is, Nissan needs to ensure they don't let it slip away as it adds a layer of confidence that is often absent in cars costing five-times as much. Straight-line stability is one thing, but the true assessment is found on the corners.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	NOUN: highway speeds; 370Z; cars; parking lot; trait; wheelbase; tires; credit; drag numbers; absence; lift; chassis tuning; Nissan; layer; confidence; cars; five-times; stability; thing; assessment; corners; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Banned to vehicles with more than two axles, the first ten miles of the freshly-paved road delivers more twists than a full season of Desperate Housewives. Not as popular as Mulholland Drive (or as crowded), it is an excellent place to wring the guts out of a small sports car. It also happens to be the identical road that faced its sibling -- the Nissan GT-R -- last summer.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Decker Canyon Road; Desperate Housewives; Nissan; 	LOCATION: Pacific Ocean; 	NOUN: State Route; aka Decker Canyon Road; kisses; Pacific Ocean; end; winds; mountain; way; vehicles; axles; miles; road; twists; season; Housewives; Mulholland Drive; place; guts; sports car; road; sibling; Nissan GT-R; summer; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

It will easily distance itself from the hapless 370Z (to be expected especially at nearly triple the price). With electronic subsystems manipulating nearly every moving part, the GT-R claws at the pavement and puts the power down perfectly. The 370Z is lacking nearly all of the masterful processing power and electronic trickery of the flagship, so it relies on its much lighter curb weight and immense cornering grip to try to play in the same league.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: doubt; GT-R; canyon road; 370Z; price; subsystems; part; GT-R claws; pavement; power; 370Z; processing power; trickery; flagship; curb weight; cornering grip; league; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Don't get us wrong, it still isn't as intimate as a	##false@@false$$	Porsche Cayman	##false@@true$$	or	##false@@false$$	Boxster	##false@@true$$	(at double the Nissan's price), but it does give you the close aural feedback that Godzilla retains at an arm's length. Bolted to an amazingly rigid platform, the non-adjustable Z suspension is tight, but there is still noticeable body roll in the corners and nose dive under braking (the Nissan would brush its lower splitter on the asphalt into a tight banked uphill turn). Under throttle, and with a slight flick of the wrist, the rear wheels can easily be coaxed to step out if the overly cautious stability control is switched off. The steering feel and ratios are both good, and the transmission gearing works well. The oversized aluminum-caliper multi-piston brakes (from Akebono, not Brembo) feel like they can stop world hunger.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; Nissan; Brembo; 	PERSON: Godzilla; 	LOCATION: Akebono; 	NOUN: result; 370Z; experience; GT-R; Porsche Cayman; Boxster; Nissan; price; feedback; Godzilla; arm; length; platform; Z suspension; body roll; corners; nose dive; Nissan; splitter; asphalt; turn; throttle; flick; wrist; wheels; stability control; feel; ratios; transmission; works; aluminum-caliper; brakes; Akebono; Brembo; world hunger; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1934760915 8 18----Others----#text.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	progress:1 fret:1 simpl:1 schumach:1 bend:1 blip:1 abl:1 close:1 handshak:1 auditori:1 open:1 unconsci:1 hear:1 swell:1 rare:1 among:1 adopt:1 care:1 head:1 follow:1 doubl:1 januari:1 art:1 heel:1 jump:1 sale:1 system:2 throttl:1 ear:1 doubtlessli:1 brilliant:1 crane:1 arriv:1 match:3 citi:1 annal:1 gearhead:1 toe:1 rev:2 edg:1 ceas:1 eventu:1 telltal:1 catch:1 engin:1 signal:1 someon:1 aspir:1 compel:1 shoemak:1 syncrorev:1 overli:1 joe:1 automak:1 motor:1 best:1 driver:1 tell:1 hardli:1 find:1 end:1 brake:1 condit:1 balanc:1 histori:1 corner:1 ey:1 gearbox:1 releg:1 come:1 us:1 offer:1 glimps:1 manual:1 dedic:1 school:1 artistri:1 stand:1 secret:1 hype:1 part:1 nissan:1 world:1 sword:1 yet:1	||	Stand on any corner in any city, close your eyes and open your ears. Eventually you'll hear the telltale swell of an engine as someone blips the throttle while braking before the bend. This secret auditory handshake among gearheads signals the arrival of a driver schooled in the art of heel-and-toe. And when the 2009 Nissan 370Z goes on sale in January, you won't be able to tell an aspiring Schumacher from Joe the... shoemaker. Nissan's simple yet brilliant "SyncroRev Match" will relegate the artistry of rev-matching to the annals of motoring history. Other automakers compelled to offer manual gearboxes for the dedicated few will doubtlessly adopt the system, and those of us who care who've unconsciously conditioned ourselves to crane our heads to catch a glimpse of what's coming will cease to do so. Progress is a double-edged sword and rarely balanced, but don't fret. The 370Z's overly hyped rev-matching system isn't the end of the world, and it's hardly the best part of Nissan's new Z.	##false@@false$$	Follow the jump	##false@@true$$	to find out what is.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; Nissan; Nissan; 	PERSON: Schumacher; Joe; 	DATE: 2009; 	NOUN: corner; city; eyes; ears; swell; engine; someone blips; throttle; bend; auditory handshake; gearheads; arrival; driver; art; heel-and-toe; Nissan 370Z; sale; January; Schumacher; Joe; shoemaker; Nissan; SyncroRev Match; artistry; annals; motoring history; automakers; gearboxes; system; crane; heads; glimpse; Progress; sword; 370Z; system; end; world; part; Nissan; Z.; jump; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1934760915 8 22----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	increas:2 cradl:1 result:1 disconcert:1 percent:3 weight:1 structur:1 overal:1 link:1 heft:1 bend:1 distribut:1 good:1 lighter:1 mildli:1 aluminum:1 carbon:1 setup:1 combin:1 valv:1 light:1 doubl:1 work:1 vertic:1 wishbon:1 composit:1 redesign:1 rear:4 rigid:1 radiat:1 front:4 us:1 hous:1 resist:1 shock:1 suspens:2 conjunct:1 remain:1 effect:2 mount:1 stiffer:1 torsion:1 bar:1 stiffen:1 keep:1 pound:1	||	But the Z's 3,232-pound heft is used to good effect. Weight distribution remains 54/46 front-to-rear, and a lighter, stiffer aluminum front suspension cradle works in conjunction with a rear-mounted V-bar and a carbon composite radiator housing to stiffen the structure while keeping it light. The result is 30 percent more torsional rigidity up front, a 22-percent increase in the back and a 30-percent increase in vertical bending resistance in the rear. Combined with the new double-wishbone front suspension, redesigned four-link rear setup and new shock valving, the overall effect is at first mildly disconcerting.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: Z; heft; effect; Weight distribution; front-to-rear; aluminum; suspension cradle; conjunction; V-bar; carbon; radiator housing; structure; result; percent; rigidity; front; increase; back; increase; resistance; rear; suspension; setup; shock valving; effect; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1934760915 8 24----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 consol:1 plastic:1 hug:1 benefit:1 infin:1 drop:1 lcd:1 tab:1 round:1 gaug:1 eight:1 expect:1 amount:1 center:1 stablem:1 help:1 fm:1 seat:1 drive:1 proper:1 tach:1 luxuri:1 central:1 oval:1 coddl:1 refresh:1 leather:1 option:1 pod:1 platform:1 liter:1 support:1 sibl:1 certainli:1 resembl:1 like:1 provid:1 bit:1 touch:1 swear:1 favor:1 stitch:1 gt:1 view:1 unobstruct:1 car:1 speedomet:1 allow:1 wheel:1 engin:1 quit:1 automat:1 kind:1 thoroughli:1 playskool:1 pivot:1 passeng:1 side:1 paddl:1 adjust:1 read:1 complet:1 bear:1 balanc:1 matter:1 speed:1 redesign:1 ghastli:1 sport:1 soft:1 ip:1 pass:1 chair:1 seven:1 dash:1 led:1 mount:1 bolster:1 steer:1 awar:1 cluster:1 shifter:1 asymmetr:1 keep:1 motiv:1	||	As you're likely well aware, the 3.7-liter VQ37VHR V6 is the same engine that motivates the Z's FM-platform stablemate, the Infiniti G37. With the optional seven-speed automatic, complete with paddle shifters, you'd swear you are driving the Z's more luxurious sibling. The thoroughly refreshed interior helps matters, dropping the Playskool plastics in favor of a soft-touch dash, redesigned IP and a leather-stitched center console that bears a passing resemblance to that of the GT-R. The eight-way adjustable driver's seat benefits from a bit more bolstering than the passenger, but both chairs balance the proper amount of coddling with the kind of side-hugging support you'd expect in a sports car. The three-pod gauge cluster still pivots to provide an unobstructed view through the asymmetrical steering wheel (it's not quite an oval, but it's certainly not round), allowing you to keep tabs on the central-mounted tach, speedometer and ghastly LCD/LED read-out.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Playskool; 	NOUN: VQ37VHR V6; engine; Z; FM-platform stablemate; Infiniti G37; paddle shifters; Z; sibling; matters; Playskool plastics; favor; dash; IP; center console; resemblance; GT-R; driver; seat benefits; bit; passenger; chairs; amount; coddling; kind; support; sports car; gauge cluster; view; steering wheel; round; tabs; tach; speedometer; LCD\/LED read-out; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 8 25----Verdict----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	consol:1 last:1 atop:1 tie:1 pseudo:1 lcd:1 dial:1 gaug:1 analog:1 temperatur:1 desir:1 spot:1 center:1 gripe:1 coolant:1 creat:1 sunlight:1 allevi:1 tradit:1 inform:1 sound:1 multi:1 leav:1 lot:1 rest:1 execut:1 small:1 compar:1 littl:1 might:1 idea:1 loss:1 set:1 pain:1 necess:1 quit:1 mirror:1 techno:1 fit:1 side:1 wash:1 fuel:1 horizont:1 trio:1 displai:1 perch:1 massiv:1 subtlest:1 camera:1 theme:1 sit:1 decid:1 led:1 instead:1 pillar:1 nissan:1 blind:1	||	We're at a loss on that last one. Instead of fitting traditional fuel and coolant temperature gauges just like the trio perched atop the center console Nissan decided to go with a set of horizontal LCDs sitting above and below a multi-information display. While the idea might be sound, the execution leaves a lot to be desired. The LEDs wash out in all but the subtlest sunlight and the pseudo-techno theme doesn't tie-in with the rest of the analog dials. -1934760915 8 26----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	detail:1 lower:1 variabl:1 churn:1 desir:1 torqu:1 cacophoni:1 cylind:1 mill:1 help:1 height:1 event:1 rang:1 rpm:3 power:1 ft:1 along:1 live:1 prove:1 liter:2 get:1 favorit:1 far:1 darwin:1 system:1 lift:1 stiffli:1 lb:1 aural:1 increas:2 hp:1 displac:1 rev:1 boast:1 vvel:1 give:1 moment:1 block:1 former:1 six:1 sprung:1 fit:1 clutch:1 valv:1 thrust:1 bean:1 let:1 come:1 forgiven:1 accompani:1 foibl:1 mount:1 remain:1 redlin:1 part:1 bent:1	||	But both of these foibles are forgiven the moment you let out the stiffly sprung clutch and give it the beans. The 3.5-liter V6 fitted to the former Z remains one of our favorite mills, but the 3.7-liter proves that Darwin lives in the details. The new bent-six is mounted 15mm lower, boasts 35% all-new parts, an increased cylinder block height, and with the help of Nissan's Variable Valve Event and Lift (VVEL) system, churns out 332 hp at 7,000 rpm and 270 lb-ft of torque at 5,200 rpm. Along with the increase in displacement and power, redline is up to 7,500 rpm, but getting that high into the rev range comes with an aural cacophony that's far less desirable than the thrust accompanying it.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	PERSON: Darwin; 	NOUN: foibles; moment; clutch; beans; 3.5-liter V6; Z; mills; Darwin; details; bent-six; %; parts; cylinder block height; help; Nissan; Valve Event; VVEL; system; hp; rpm; lb-ft; torque; rpm; increase; displacement; power; redline; rpm; rev range; cacophony; thrust; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The standard brakes (12.6-inch fronts, 12.1-inch rears) are tossed in favor of 14-inch rotors in front and 13.8-inch discs out back, and the variable ratio brake pedal, Electronic Brake-force Distribution and Brake Assist all work together with the ABS and Vehicle Dynamic Control (VDC) to provide a suitable safety net for ham-fisted frat-boys intent on exploring the Z's substantial limits of adhesion on public roads.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: ABS; Vehicle Dynamic Control; 	LOCATION: Bridgestone Potenza; 	NOUN: Sport Package; 370Z; RAYS wheels shod; Bridgestone Potenza RE050A rubber; front; rear; brakes; fronts; rears; favor; rotors; front; discs; ratio brake pedal; Brake-force Distribution; Brake; work; ABS; Vehicle Dynamic Control; VDC; safety net; intent; Z; limits; adhesion; roads; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 8 28----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	plagu:1 last:1 test:1 gener:1 kill:1 rack:1 amount:1 toward:1 grand:1 rare:1 civilian:1 trail:1 refresh:1 limit:1 control:2 sensit:1 get:1 rotat:1 provid:1 pedal:1 opportun:1 viscou:1 input:1 acceler:1 earlier:1 fang:1 better:1 dam:1 impress:1 air:1 compar:1 press:1 smooth:1 allow:1 underst:1 judici:1 grit:1 worri:1 predecessor:1 apex:1 setup:1 best:1 perfect:2 brake:2 elicit:1 speed:1 later:1 pinion:1 revel:1 traction:2 track:1 slip:1 sport:1 termin:1 mount:1 tour:1 world:1 differenti:1	||	While the 370Z does its best grand-touring impression in the civilian world, the refreshed Z grits its new air-dam-mounted fangs and goes in for the kill out on the track. Even with the traction control on, the 370Z is a revelation compared to its predecessor. Smooth inputs allow you to brake later, accelerate earlier and rarely worry about the terminal understeer that plagued the last generation. With the traction control off, it gets even better. Trail-braking elicits the perfect amount of rotation towards the apex and with the Sport Package's viscous limited-slip differential, a judicious press of the long pedal provides the perfect opportunity to test the Z's speed-sensitive rack-and-pinion setup.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Sport Package; 	NOUN: 370Z; grand-touring impression; world; Z; fangs; kill; track; traction control; 370Z; revelation; predecessor; inputs; brake; understeer; generation; traction control; amount; rotation; apex; Sport Package; press; pedal; opportunity; Z; setup; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 8 29----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	particularli:1 unload:1 mountain:1 drop:1 bend:1 lead:1 enough:1 harsh:1 feather:1 gear:1 correct:2 slope:1 downward:1 bush:1 camber:1 head:1 sens:1 right:3 follow:1 turn:1 ranch:1 alert:1 third:1 exit:1 record:1 appli:1 throttl:1 lighten:1 load:1 make:1 readi:1 straight:1 forewarn:1 thing:1 wheel:1 cumbersom:1 slightli:1 hander:1 set:1 next:1 explor:1 quick:2 line:1 brought:1 road:1 someth:1 spring:1 tackl:1 short:1 hand:1 damper:1 mildli:1 full:1 solenoid:1 left:1 valv:1 perfect:1 motorsport:1 end:1 feel:1 redesign:1 rear:1 neuron:1 quickli:1 fourth:1 suspens:1 mount:1 act:1 chanc:1 weighti:1	||	With redesigned mounting bushings and a solenoid valve that acts like a damper under harsh loads, the weighty feel of a wheel that was mildly cumbersome on the road makes perfect sense when applying quick corrections -- something we had the chance to explore on a particularly short downward slope leading into the first turn at Spring Mountain Motorsports Ranch. With a slightly off-camber exit following a drop into a right-hand bend, the rear suspension unloaded quickly (for the record, we were forewarned) and the back end lightened just enough to set our neurons on full alert. A quick correction to the left while feathering the throttle brought things right back into line, and we were headed down the straight in third, then fourth gear, ready to tackle the next right-hander.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: bushings; valve; damper; loads; feel; wheel; road; sense; corrections; something; chance; slope; turn; Spring Mountain Motorsports Ranch; exit; drop; bend; suspension; record; end; neurons; alert; correction; throttle; things; line; gear; right-hander; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 8 30----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	memori:1 muscl:1 foot:1 composur:1 bend:1 blip:1 flawless:1 enough:1 ga:1 amount:1 break:1 roll:1 button:1 nomin:1 right:1 light:1 onto:1 hairpin:1 fun:1 pedal:1 third:1 system:2 bodi:1 throttl:1 disabl:1 impress:1 match:1 small:1 doodad:1 stop:1 rev:1 press:1 stick:1 engin:1 syncrorev:1 pivot:1 habit:1 die:1 best:1 lap:1 subconsci:1 hard:2 brake:2 let:1 drag:1 dive:1 sport:1 despit:1 around:1 awar:1 nearli:2 shifter:1 induc:1	||	Hard braking induces a small amount of dive, but not nearly enough to break the Z's composure, and body roll in the bends is nominal at best. Despite being aware of the SyncroRev Match system, our muscle memory subconsciously pivoted our right foot onto the gas pedal while braking before the hairpin. As impressive as the throttle-blipping doodad is (it's fun to drag the shifter around at stop lights and let the engine rev), after our third lap we disabled it by pressing the S-Sport button above the stick. The system is nearly flawless, but old habits die hard.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: amount; dive; Z; composure; body roll; bends; SyncroRev Match system; muscle memory; foot; gas pedal; hairpin; doodad; fun; shifter; stop lights; engine rev; lap; S-Sport button; stick; system; habits; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The wheelbase of this sixth-generation car is almost four inches shorter than the previous-generation 350Z, and all of the sheet metal is new. Overall, the 2009 Nissan 370Z is 2.7 inches shorter and 1.3 inches wider, and although the styling has something plainly in common with the previous (2008) model, almost every plane and contour is subtly or distinctly different.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; Nissan; 	DATE: 2009; 2008; 	NOUN: Nissan; 370Z; car; wheelbase; car; inches; 350Z; sheet metal; Nissan 370Z; inches; inches; styling; something; model; plane; contour; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

The Sport package (3,000) adds 19-inch forged lightweight aluminum-alloy Rays wheels, fitted with Bridgestone Potenza RE050A high-performance radials. Spoilers are fitted fore and aft, and lower the car's drag coefficient from 0.29 to 0.28. Also included with the Sport package are higher-spec brakes with 14-inch front rotors and 13.8-inch rear rotors (versus 12.6/12.1-inch standard rotor sizes) with four-piston front and two-piston rear aluminum calipers. -1934760915 8 54----Exterior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	lower:1 weight:2 door:1 obvious:1 obviou:1 although:2 aluminum:2 tell:1 immedi:1 hood:2 support:1 strength:1 rear:1 us:1 steel:1 despit:1 quest:1 bodi:2 aspect:1 ad:1 hatch:1 claim:1 reduct:1 nissan:1 previou:1 pound:1	||	Although it's not immediately obvious, one of the most telling aspects of the car's body is that the doors, rear hatch and hood are all made from aluminum, obviously in the quest for lower weight. -1934760915 8 56----Interior----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	interior:1 gener:1 segment:1 spoke:1 skim:1 close:1 center:1 bold:1 button:1 beefi:1 sixth:1 leather:1 control:2 perfor:1 much:1 huge:1 solid:1 tightli:1 centerpiec:1 thick:1 materi:1 stereo:1 low:1 car:1 wheel:2 escap:1 hand:1 share:1 circumfer:1 rent:1 cruis:1 look:2 boss:1 produc:1 tech:1 around:1 clad:1 maxima:1 richer:1 differ:1 dash:1 effect:1 larg:1 appropri:1 steer:1 stud:1 improv:1 gleam:1 design:1	||	The interior is hugely improved in this sixth generation Z-car, with much richer-looking materials and a design that escapes the low-rent effect of the old 350Z. A high-tech looking steering wheel (shared with the Maxima) is a bold centerpiece in the dash, a large Z gleaming in its center boss. The wheel was skimmed to produce differing thicknesses around its circumference, and tightly clad in solid and perforated leather at the appropriate segments. Buttons stud the beefy spokes for close-at-hand control of the stereo and cruise control.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: interior; generation Z-car; materials; design; effect; 350Z; wheel; Maxima; centerpiece; dash; Z gleaming; center boss; wheel; thicknesses; circumference; leather; segments; Buttons; spokes; control; stereo; cruise control; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Rear luggage space is quite decent now, and the rear hatch provides unimpeded access. The big rear B-pillars produce distinct blind spots, but can be worked around quite well by positioning the large outside mirrors to compensate.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: support bar; luggage space; car; way; midsection; bar; seats; role; luggage space; hatch; access; B-pillars; spots; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

Since the 370Z uses a much-modified version of Nissan's FM platform, we expected some of the tail-happiness we've seen in cars using that chassis. But while we could occasionally provoke a spot of tail-wagging by adding too much power at corner exits, or by turning hard on a trailing throttle, the transition was progressive and easy to read.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	LOCATION: Spring Mountain Motorsports Park; Nevada; 	NOUN: Sport model; Spring Mountain Motorsports Park; Nevada; car; course; manor; 370Z; version; Nissan; FM platform; tail-happiness; cars; chassis; spot; power; corner exits; throttle; transition; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$

-1934760915 8 68----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	legwork:1 call:1 idea:1 rev:1 can:1 engin:1 help:1 requir:1 among:1 purist:2 clutch:2 unlik:1 synchrorev:1 lever:1 synchro:1 deni:1 doubl:1 feel:1 speed:1 select:1 true:1 us:1 neutral:1 synchron:1 occas:1 peopl:1 sensat:1 brilliant:1 prefer:1 shift:1 upon:1	||	Unlike true double-clutching, SynchroRev does not first select neutral then rev the engine to the required speed, so the synchronizers are still called upon to help out. You can feel the sensation through the shift lever as the synchros clutch in, and the purists among us would still prefer to do our own legwork. But there's no denying that it's a brilliant idea for most people, and even for purists on occasion.	##false@@false$$		||	NOUN: double-clutching; SynchroRev; engine; speed; synchronizers; sensation; shift lever; synchros; purists; legwork; idea; people; purists; occasion; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
-1934760915 8 69----DriveRide----#text.P.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.DIV.BODY.HTML.#document	need:1 lower:1 vvel:1 ventur:1 seri:1 broad:1 variabl:1 engin:2 torqu:1 vq:1 time:1 endow:1 rpm:2 clutch:1 valv:1 hardli:1 famou:1 hullabaloo:1 turn:1 forai:1 speed:1 know:1 sign:1 system:1 often:1 growl:1 redlin:1 manner:1 improv:1 spread:1	||	Nissan's VVEL variable-valve timing systems has endowed the 370Z with a very broad torque spread, so forays to the 7500-rpm redline are not often needed. But when you do venture there, the famous high-rpm hullabaloo and clutch growl we know so well from the VQ-engine series turns back up. But it's hardly there at all at lower engine speeds, and that's another sign of the car's improved manners.	##false@@false$$		||	ORGANIZATION: Nissan; 	NOUN: Nissan; VVEL variable-valve timing systems; 370Z; torque spread; forays; redline; venture; hullabaloo; clutch growl; series; engine speeds; sign; car; manners; 	||	##true@@false$$	||	##false@@false$$
